reviewer_info: Becca, 35-44 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)

reviewer_info: bv, 13-18 Female  (Caregiver)
comment: Great way to tell about a drug. You make it seem so interesting.

reviewer_info: Kaylin Mason, 13-18 Female  (Consumer)
comment: I have experienced ringing in the ears. Not sure whether or not I have had an irregular heart beat, although I thought it had happened once. reviewer_info: krayphysh, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:

reviewer_info: T.o, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Consumer)
comment: I use 200 mg in the morning before I take Ritalin. It seems to me that I function better the days I use both. 13-18 Male  (Consumer)
comment: While caffeine is not as effective as medications such as adderall, it can help me focus if I use the right amount.  I have found that I am able to focus better in all of my college classes when I drink coffee and take a stimulant medication.

reviewer_info: on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
comment: Caffeine withdrawal can produce moderate to severe headaches accompanied by nausea and dizziness, lasting over 12 hours.  The headache usually appears 1 to 2 days after suspended use.  These symptoms can be treated with a dose of caffeine eliminating them within 10 minutes.  This is why headache preparations with caffeine are so effective while pure aspirin provides no headache relief from a caffeine withdrawal headache.  Those sensitive to caffeine may experience a caffeine withdrawal headache with the consumption of a single cola soft drink.  The 1 to 2 day delay of the headache makes it hard to associate the cause and effect.

reviewer_info: jdesautels, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
J.Parsons EMT-B, 25-34 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment: Use it to help my pain medication be more effective.

reviewer_info: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment: I have found that 1 caffine pill (200mg) along with IB takes my morning migraine headaches away in about 30 min most days.  I only use over the counter pain killers and when I do not use the caffine with the IB then it won't work.  Reading this site I now know why.  Of course, this means that when I fell a migraine coming on at night I just have to endure until the morning because if I take my usual concoction I will not be able to sleep...this is the only down side of taking caffine pills to releive my headaches.  THe other up side though is it helps me to wake up and get my day started.  everything has it's ups and downs...use in moderation.

reviewer_info: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more
comment: I have had migraines for over 13 years ago.  I have tried every treatment that there is out there, most have not helped at all.  My migraines are everyday from the time I wake up to the time I go to sleep.  The first doctor I saw suggested caffeine pills, they maybe my heart flutter to much.  Then he suggested for me to drink coffee or soda all day, that has worked to keep the migraines where I can handle them.  I am now trying an injectable and it scars me, so I drink coke for most of my day.

reviewer_info: 16susan, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment: I have a long history of migraines sometimes with allergies/changes of weather/locations.  Now the prescriptions drugs do not work well and I am finding caffeine pills work best - not drinking anything with caffeine as that does not work for me.  Also I rarely drink anything with caffeine in it on a daily basis.  Some times I can take 1/4 pill and sometimes 1/2.

reviewer_info: DarleneRoss00, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)

reviewer_info: Butterball, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)
comment: Hello! I'm a 25 yr old female with chronic asthma and when I drink coffee it cleans out my respiratory system by breaking up the mucus that my body automatic makes. When asthmatics get sick i's pretty much game over for us but when you do drink a cup of coffee when you feel like your going to have an attack it's a great reliver until you get to the hospital. Overall, I say that coffee is wondering if you have a chronic respiratory problem like I do. The only downfall is that it stains your teeth so you have to keep up your teeth by either brushing them after you finish drinking or go to the dentist every three months to get a whitening.

reviewer_info: just me, 45-54 Female  (Consumer)
comment: I drink coffee because I love the taste, but I don't have to have it to wake up.  Sometimes I don't have my first cup  until an hour or more after I've been up for the day.  As for headaches, I find I get a headache if I go without caffeine, but using caffeine to relieve it doesn't work.  Once I get a "caffeine withdrawal" headache, 'medicating' myself with it doesn't take it away.

reviewer_info: Tim, 55-64 Male  (Consumer)
comment: All caffeine drinks are not equal. Not including simple mixes such as soda, or "Red Bull" like drinks which add caffeine, drinks like Tea, Coffee, and Chocolate (Cocoa) are for the most part derived from simple beans. Because beans haven't begun development yet they contain primarily simple compounds. Tea however is derived from a leaf. Leaves are complex factories that produce hundreds of compounds... one of which is Theanine. This compound counters the bad effects of Caffeine (more or less depending on leaf content). As a result Tea should be considered different from other drinks. Also if consumed as a whole leaf either steeped multiple times (Chinese method known as Gongfu) Tea  provides huge doses of antioxidents with decreasing levels of Caffeine allowing Tea to “Wake you in the morning, keep you throughout the day, and put you to sleep soundly at night.” This due to decreasing Caffeine, and the “soporific” (sleep inducing) effect of  Theanine.

reviewer_info: Jazzymom, 45-54 Female  (Consumer)
comment: I believe cola does not cause direct damage to the vocal cords. Caffeinated drinks acting as a diuretic remove hydration from the body and that de-hydration can cause great discomfort and lead to damage of the vocal cords.

comment: It doesn't help my short attention span seemingly at all. The end. Use a bit of exercise, planning, and motivation building as healthier alternatives to help you deal with your tasks.

comment: if i don't take in a certain amount of coffee per day, i get headaches, i find that drinking coffee helps with my headaches. it is proven that caffine helps reduce swelling of the vessels and arteries in the brain.

reviewer_info: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment: I like the 90% of Americans who use caffeine used it to help wake me up in the mornings. My overuse of caffeine has caused immense health problems for me. It was the leading cause of my Acid Reflux (GERD) disorder. My symptoms are rare but becaume commonplace with persistent use. My symptoms include vomiting, nautiousness, gas (excessive burping), nervous twitching, and depression/anxiety. I won't tell you to stop using caffeine, but be aware of its effects and at least try to limit your use.

reviewer_info: i have no name, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Consumer)
comment: There's almost nothing better than waking up to a nice cup of coffee! It seems to have a nasty rebound effect when it wears off, however.

reviewer_info: Brandon, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Consumer)
comment:
Clearly this is a drug we all love, and love to hate. I think it speaks for itself. I was told by my gasterointerologist that it is a great laxative. Just a word to the weary about that, I'm not sure how accurate the side effects page on this is listing diarrhea as a "rare" side effect, but I suppose the days where insomnia is your only company and the next day of work mocks you for it, on those days it's worth putting up with the less than pleasant side effects for the ability to stay up and get the job done. Just remember to back off the stuff when your hands start shaking, figure out how long it takes to get through your system and space out the caffeine in those intervals to avoid overdose. for me it's about 2-3 hours. Body weight plays a factor, I happen to be a lean man in his mid 20's, so you may have separate circumstances. It is easy to build up a tolerance similar to alcohol requiring substantially more to get the same effect. This also creates a chemical dependency that can cause migraines when your brain is deprived of it. I avoid this by putting up with the migraines for a few days and avoid caffeinated food and supplements for up to 3 months. After that time I generally have brought my brain's chemical dependency to next to nil and my tolerance back down to healthier levels.

Always in moderation, and remember, never do any physically demanding activities when you've taken caffeine, it reduces lung capacity and robs your muscles of nutrients causing them to fatigue very fast under strain. You can create heart problems if you are under it's effects and subject your heart to too much strain, your base heart rate is already elevated and the extra strain can be painful to endure.

reviewer_info: PAPA PUMP, 35-44 Male  (Consumer)
comment: Please stop using stims!!! I learned the hard way, I ended up in ICU at Mayo Clinic. I would start my day taking 60mg. of Ritalin, then start making the rounds to the stores around town. I was averaging 8 to 10 pints of Monster, Red Bull, ect. Its not worth Heart problems, insomnia, and most people have a whole range of other Health related troubles. please...do like our Parents and family did, coffee at breakfast you know what I mean. USE IN MODERATION!!!

Just a word to the weary about that, I'm not sure how accurate the side effects page on this is listing diarrhea as a "rare" side effect, but I suppose the days where insomnia is your only company and the next day of work mocks you for it, on those days it's worth putting up with the less than pleasant side effects for the ability to stay up and get the job done. Just remember to back off the stuff when your hands start shaking, figure out how long it takes to get through your system and space out the caffeine in those intervals to avoid overdose. for me it's about 2-3 hours. Body weight plays a factor, I happen to be a lean man in his mid 20's, so you may have separate circumstances. It is easy to build up a tolerance similar to alcohol requiring substantially more to get the same effect. This also creates a chemical dependency that can cause migraines when your brain is deprived of it. I avoid this by putting up with the migraines for a few days and avoid caffeinated food and supplements for up to 3 months. After that time I generally have brought my brain's chemical dependency to next to nil and my tolerance back down to healthier levels.

Always in moderation, and remember, never do any physically demanding activities when you've taken caffeine, it reduces lung capacity and robs your muscles of nutrients causing them to fatigue very fast under strain. You can create heart problems if you are under it's effects and subject your heart to too much strain, your base heart rate is already elevated and the extra strain can be painful to endure.

reviewer_info: albertw, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)
comment:
I'd been using melatonin regularly for 4 years with great efficacy for the treatment of insomnia and anxiety. However, a year ago I began experiencing issues with peripheral vascular disease associated with varicose veins (ulcerations and subcutaneous bleeding on my calves, joint pain and stiffness, planar fasciitis and chronic leg cramps). 

Within weeks of treating my varicose veins with compression stockings and elevation, I noted increased postural tachycardia, which became debilitating after 3 months (could no longer work). While waiting to see my PCP, I came off the melatonin and both my tachycardia and varicose veins began improving significantly. Three weeks after discontinuing its use, the tachycardia disappeared and the varicose veins improved enough to allow me to go without compressions stockings for intervals of several hours.

Have found nothing to explain the correlation but for a study in European Journal of Phramocology, vol 345, 1 March 1998 (NIH medical journal database), where the authors discuss the presence of MT1 & MT2 receptors (to which melatonin binds) in smooth muscle of vascular tissue and their role in vasodilation and constriction, respectively, as an explanation for melatonin’s systemic efficacy.

While my overall condition improved when I discontinued use, I did experience a brief period of cognitive impairment and an uptick in mean blood pressure, the latter of which may require me to seek treatment should it persist. Finally have a follow-up with a cardiologist.

comment: I've created a "best use" for me that I invented.  More than one Milligram is too much and causes vivid dreams.  The correct or natural dose is about 100 Micro-Grams in your blood stream. reviewer_info: Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)
comment:
If you find the right one, yes, melatonin can be effective. Possibly even "addictive" (or cause a dependence); I'm tempted to take the "good ones" for afternoon naps!

But the problem is, each brand and dose of melatonin (and possibly each "batch") is SO different. A few brands have worked consistently better than prescription sleep aids for me, but unfortunately MOST brands are either ineffective, or produce the opposite effect desired (eg, I needed a Xanax to counteract the nervous, gittery feelings, then I still couldn't sleep but at least I wasn't jittery.)

One 3mg brand I like is pretty consistent for me (and $3/month! cheap!), but the same brand has a few other doses, plus a "dissolvable" 3mg dose with sweetening added, and of course all the bottles look the same, so I've accidentally bought the wrong ones (or if the right ones were sold out, tried another dose): ALL the other doses of the "good brand" didn't work. And the sugary one gave me the "nervousness" effect.

After a few YEARS of trying melatonin for sleep (on and off), though I have a decent one now, I really think the FDA should be looking at what these vitamin companies put into these pills. At least there should be consistency from "batch to batch" (same brand/dose).

So when you hit luck with a good one, it's very effective. But it really feels like a crapshoot when you open the next bottle. I'd love to put my brand/dose as 5-star satisfaction, but since this review is just "melatonin", I've got to consider the rest of my experiences with melatonin. Mostly positive, but even the few times I've gotten "the jitters" ...why package and sell a sleep aid that makes insomnia a nightmare? It makes it tempting to go back to prescription meds (where the FDA at least has a say).

reviewer_info: LotusDancer, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Consumer)
comment: I am old (71) and also have ADD, both leading to sleep onset disorder. I take Melatonin about 20 minutes before retiring and I find I slowly grow sleepy, sleep soundly for about 6 hours, then less soundly until I get up. I feel refreshed and alert when starting my morning. I have also noticed an improvement in healing time as well as overnight clearing of things like small cysts, sores, even bruises.

reviewer_info: Gma Julie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment: I have used melatonin for several years as does my husband. I like that it is not addictive. I particularly like it when my schedule is irregular and I need to get to bed earlier than normal for an early am appointment. It gets you sleepy in about 20 mins. (of course it's best to start settling down for the evening). It is a dream enhancer though, the higher the dose as in 5-10mg the more one will tend to dream. This can make one feel as though they haven't slept. Best to start with a small dose and increase until you find a dosage that makes you sleepy in the 20 min range. Then go to bed. If you don't your body will just work it through and it will do no good. I also like to combine this with Valerian root which produces a sound sleep. Also non addictive. One of each on any given work night is about the right dose for me.  The melatonin dose is 1mg and the valerian is 500 mg.  I have taken up to 10 mg of melatonin with no ill effects, however you will need 8-11 hours of sleep with that dosage and you may still wake up groggy. I have also taken up to 2000 mg of valerian root with no ill effects and no grogginess (in case you have never taken valerian root it smells like dirty socks, really dirty socks lol).  Both products are relatively inexpensive. My size is 5'4" and I weight around 145-150. Judge your dosage according to your size. I have used nearly all makes and models of both products

reviewer_info: CircleInTheSquare, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment:
I have been taking melatonin for about 12 years for sleep problems - started at about 300 mcg ~1/2 hour before bedtime, increasing, when effectiveness lagged, gradually to 3 mg (i use the Natrol 3 mg tablet, which was not listed, so I used the Natrol 5 mg for this comment). Added 50 mg Bendryl (diphenhydramine)per night a few years ago and have not needed to change either dose since. I sleep through the night and wake up refreshed but sometimes a bit groggy. A good cardio workout takes care of that. Very important - try cutting down, or better, eliminating caffeine. 
I've tried a number of brands of melatonin, but many don't work. I've settled on Natrol, because it works. There are probably others that work also, but I haven't seen any reason to experiment unless/until the Natrol becomes unavailable or stops working. Remember that these are not manufactured as drugs and there is no required test for what's in the tablet. If the first brand doesn't work for  you, try others until you find one. That doesn't mean you will necessarily succeed - melatonin doesn't work for everybody. Try it, though. Start with low doses and adjust as you see how it affects you. Good luck!

reviewer_info: John shepherd, 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
comment:
Benzodiazepines cause tolerance and physical dependence within two to four weeks, and, upon cessation acute withdrawal traditionally requires tapered management. Additionally in some long term users experience withdrawal syndrome. Withdrawal syndrome can last many months and is typified by a major depressive episode, agitation, and lack of ability to get to sleep. This is a serious side effect which needs careful monitoring.
ol
For this reason Benzodiazepines need to be used with extreme caution and for very short periods.

Melatonin is effective for sleep disturbances that are not caused by an over active nervous system, such is in the case of Benzodiazepine withdrawal. It appears virtually ineffective during acute (tapered) withdrawal, although somewhat helpful during withdrawal syndrome. For this reason it's main purpose during withdrawal is an adjunct with other therapies.

To my knowledge Melatonin does not effect the calcium channels that have been disturbed by benzodiazepine usage and this is why, in my view, Melatonin is not very effective on it's own as an Anxiolytic (antianxiety agent.)

My experience is that SSRI's are not very effective for use for withdrawal, however responses to SSRI's are individual dependant.

It is essential to manage benzodiazepine withdrawal and protracted withdrawal syndrome using a variety of methods including CBT, but most effectively, using an alternative Anxiolytic, the most effective of which is Phenibut (CALMEXA).

Phenibut Calmexa is GABA with a phenyl ring that allows it to pass the blood brain barrier, therefore replacing the GABA depleted by benzodiazepine dependence. With medical management it can safely and entirely replace the use of Benzodiazepines, causing an alternative dependence both easier to taper with less risk of protracted withdrawal syndrome. 

Melatonin used together with Phenibut is very effective for inducing sleep, establishing and maintaining a sleeping pattern.

reviewer_info: mac, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
comment:
I have a chronic back pain condition with degenerative disc disease, herniated discs, stenosis, and a host of other things including high blood pressure and sleep apnea.  My pain tolerance is so high that even the class 2 meds i take give short term relief. One doc in the er came back after giving pain shot and was shocked I was still awake saying I gave you enough to knock out a horse. He had not seen that high tolerance before.
I was unable to use my cpap correctly because I was tossing and turning in pain or discomfort in finding a comfortable sleep position and waking up because of the apnea.   I have had  chronic insomnia for over 20 years tried everything including prescription meds. Tried melatonin appropriate 2 months ago. Been able to get at least 4 to 5 straight hours of sleep. Wake up not drowsy and feeling more rested than I have in years. From a chronic pain and insomnia suffered this gives me hope. I use to be so tired during the day from restless night. I know there was strain on my heart and body due to constant lack of sleep. Now I can use the cpap with the goal of reaching 6 to 8 hours. reviewer_info: Komp23, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
I am a 32 year old male, 6'5" and roughly 170 lbs (at my heaviest), diagnosed with fibro 2.5 years ago, infrequent (0-5 cigarettes/day) smoker, very little (1-2 drinks/week) alchohol use, 1-2 cups of coffee per day (never past 5pm); exercises (yoga + strenuous stretching) 6 days/week. Trouble falling and staying asleep. Erratic work schedule. I use melatonin infrequently but with extremely high doses (ie used 20mg last night). Result: vivid dreams, but it helps to keep me asleep. Normally I'll sleep for 4 hours, then wake, sometimes can't fall asleep again. Chronic fatigue. I'm reviewing just to let people know that this dosage is safe for me (I feel well rested, still tired but not wired, not irritable). The dreams are to be looked out for, like I said extremely vivid especially the first couple times using melatonin.
The diagnose of fibro should convey to readers that I have experienced chronic physiological (specifically muscular and nervous system) arousal for prolonged periods of time (10-15 years) due to environmental and emotional stress & poor cultural/familial support for stress resolution. Worst instance of emotional stress from 9-22 years old. It has not been fun. If you are in a similar circumstance, good luck to you, I know you know how difficult reversing/counteracting this situation can be.

Usually, I get around a few hours of sleep, early in the morning, because of a combination of Vyvanse and my mother keeping the television on all night. In the morning, when my mother tried to 'wake me up,' which was annoying because she yelled a lot. Today, all day, I felt like I was going to vomit. I have had a lot of head rushes in the past few weeks, which could be because of high blood pressure caused by the Vyvanse, and the head rushes are really bad, from able to be ignored to extreme amounts of pain and almost fainting, but I can live with the head rushes. I feel almost addicted to school, the homework and projects keep me from sitting there and not doing anything, which has gotten me scared about summer. I am intimidated and almost scared about what I will do when I am alone, and not taking drivers ed or going to summer school to learn about high school schedules, because I cannot sleep most nights, I wake up early but am not a morning person, and I feel sick most days when I am not working. Does anyone have any tips about getting to sleep? I have zero sense of time, the only way I know it is morning is because of the extremely loud and stupid birds. I need some tips, help me internet.

reviewer_info: drk, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment:
I have an extremely wide wake/sleep cycle and tried melatonin to help get on a regular cycle. Taking 5mg didn't kick in until an hour had passed, but I would wake up almost every hour afterwards. Those moments of being awake were met with distorted vision/mild hallucinations. Every wake felt like a power nap, and I'd force myself to sleep again. 

The hallucinations involved watery vision, where everything resembled liquid waves, and complete distortion of light. I've only experienced something similar in my childhood during a shroom trip. As far as I know I'm the only person in my circle to ever experience this melatonin trip effect, and unlike the shrooms it was nonstimulant and basically I thought I was going crazy. 

Upped the dose to 10mg the next night just to test, and it was identical, no more or less crazy.

I suppose this works for some people, but I really can't handle whatever it is doing to my mind or body. Like I said before tho, I must be a super rare case.

comment: I have been using Melatonin for a few months now. The past month or so, I have been having very intense, strange & vivid dreams. Also, I can remember them. Before I began taking it I very rarely had dreams or nightmares. I have been doing a little research online and have found that when your quality of sleep gets better, number of dreams (as well as recalling them) increases. I have also learned that taking 6mg per night (my dosage) has no known ill effects and is very safe. Some studies even show health benefits, although I'm not sure how many are verified. While it does help me get to sleep at night, and usually doesn't cause much more than normal morning drowsiness, the content of my dreams are VERY strange, and very vivid. I would recommend this product, as it is a chemical that your brain naturally releases & has not been known to cause dependancy like other OTC sleep aids. While it works great, I would tell anyone thinking about taking it to expect to have strange dreams. Anyone else having strange dreams caused by melatonin?

reviewer_info: hypernyc, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)
comment: Had non 24-hour sleep-wake disorder for twenty years.  I take 3mg of melatonin approximately mid-day to advance my sleep phase.  The timing needs to be precise in relationship to my internal body clock, which is not always easy to know.  If I wake after an hour of heavy dream sleep, my waking time is a reliable marker and I will take melatonin eight hours later.  If I hit the right timing window, I'll have fairly strong fatigue within an hour.  This lasts for a couple of hours.  I can't do certain kinds of work in this state, but I can do housework and listen to lectures.  I call it my stupid pill, but it doesn't actually make me stupid, but impairs my ability to generate outward focus.  Missing my window even once can make it hard to recover the required timing accuracy.  The difference is profound.  I can tell I miss the window because I have far less fatigue.  Taking coffee at the same time as the melatonin significantly reduces fatigue, but it also made the treatment less reliable.  Used to have an "all nighter" without fail at least once every three weeks for twenty years.  In my first year on melatonin, I lost control only three times and had to flip over.  Variability in the potency messed me up on one of those.  One vendor didn't work at all.  Another vendor works well most of the time, but some bottles aren't all there.  Think I get mild stomach irritation at night, nothing really to complain about, and it could be other things in the pill.  My life is spectacularly better since I discover this, having found the research myself.  Would love to find a 100% consistent formulation.

comment:
My six year old has behavioral issues and would not sleep. Her psyciatrist recommended 3mg melatonin a 1/2 hour before bedtime. reviewer_info: Nameless Artist with ADD, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
I started taking 5-HTP for depression and anxiety. I experienced results within three days of taking 50mg once a day in the AM. It works for me, YMMV. The mood effect is subtle but consistent. My mood feels more stable, particularly more resilient. I have fewer anxiety spikes.

I didn't take it for sleep disturbance, but it has improved the quality of sleep significantly. I wake up much earlier and without grogginess when I've taken it the day before. I also have dreams that I remember. Part of the stress resilience I feel may come from the effects the 5-HTP has had on my sleep.

It's probably not a plug-and-play supplement that can safely be taken on its own. Do your research. I take l-tyrosine with it (to prevent dopamine depletion/imbalance). The recommended ratio is 10:1, but my body seems to do better with 5:1. Because 5-HTP can cause heart valve damage via increased peripheral serotonin, I take EGCG (which effectively neutralizes the peripheral serotonin that doesn't make it past the BBB) and omega-3 (to increase bio-availability of the EGCG).

reviewer_info: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: Took for 2 days in a combo herb supplement for sleep from Whole Foods. The 2nd day I had severe numbness and tingling in my feet and up my legs. My arms were becoming numb too. I looked it up on the internet and found that this herb can cause an incurable disease called EMS (Eosinophilia Myalgia Syndrome). People have died from this disease. In 1989 there was an outbreak of it from Tryptophan. Numbness and tingling in the feet is one of the symptoms. I was scared to death. I waited a week to see if the "pins and needles" went away but they didn't, so went to an Urgent Care. They took my blood and urine. After 5 days they told me that my test results were normal but wanted me to get tested again. Now after 3 weeks the pins and needles are going away. I seem more sensitive now to other side effects though. I would never touch this again. L-Tryptophan is the same thing. I think it should be banned.

I had already begun a change in my mentality before the 5-HTP that was pulling me out of my depression but the 5-HTP just catapulted me straight upwards and I feel that it is speeding the process. Somedays I just look around me and am in this feeling of wonder and aliveness. It's like that feeling of life has been handed back to me. It's very meditative. I would recommend this BUT I am worried about heart valve issues if used for a long-term time, so I will be weaning off of this slowly now as I believe I have already gained what I wanted from it. Though I do think the heart valve damage is very unlikely with normal use, as one study I read used HEROIC doses on rats for 3 months, no human being is likely to be using such doses so as long as you make this a short treatment, it is wonderful!

reviewer_info: Zu Bub, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment:
Hi. I feel it's my duty to let everybody know that 5-htp actually works. I'll be honest with you and admit that I've been experimenting with MDMA, which on some occasion brought me lows (depression) for a few days after consuming it. Hearing it can help manage those symptoms, I decided to buy it. (It's really a harm reduction strategy and not an encouragment do to MDMA!)

Since buying 5-HTP, I've taken it twice, and NOT after MDMA but while completely sober and feeling fine, and unexpectedly it made me a whole lot more content and healed some low level anxieties. It actually made me feel good and not crave any kind of drug to make me more happy (i.e. alcohol, tobbaco, MDMA). It's not that I'm an addict by any means, but I often have this desire to get f****d up for no good reason really. It also made me sleep a whole lot better, without waking up during the night, and the dreams were crazy vivid and life-like but I liked it, it's interesting. Oh yeah, and there were some "side effects": sleepines, perhaps not feeling mentally as sharp, feeling a bit mellowed out. Well, it's not that any of these are bad by themselves, but they can sort of have an effect on your productivity. Taking it before bad is probably the wisest, so you sleep it over. :)

I forgot to mention: The first time I took 200 mg and I think it was a bit too much. I was feeling very balanced and in good mood, but overpowered by side effects. Second time it was 50 mg before sleep.

I'm not saying I'll start to use it regularly, but I can see it's potential for reducing depression and anxiety. It's legal and it really does have an effect which is definietly not placebo. I personally could probably reccomend it even for just having fun or relaxing. Why not take 100 or 200mg and chill out with friends? It does have some slightly euphoric effects. IMO far better and helthier than drinking booze or doing some drugs to achieve that feeling or get rid of anxieties. Just a thought!

Wish you the best :)

reviewer_info: Chris, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
I take a 100mg pill in the morning every 4-7 days and its very good for treating depression. Effects usually hit 2-4 hours after taking it: general boost in mood, difficult to think negative thoughts, warm fuzzy feeling, sometimes even euphoria. Feelings of love, from loving what you're doing, to feeling better about people around you. Similar feeling to MDMA. I don't know why, it might just be my experience, but the effects seriously last 3 days or so. Then for about 3-4 more days just a general content feeling. After about a week you're back at baseline but I swear that's better than before when I never took any anti-depressants. 

BTW, messing with serotonin is dangerous, why I've never sought to get prescribed SSRIs or anything. That's why I only take 1 100mg pill every few days, it only takes a small amount to change the balance of serotonin in your brain. It takes other chemicals in your brain to work....so too much, and you might not even feel the desired effects, just the bad side effects. 100mg/day to me would be crazy. Side effects include a stiff jaw/temples, headaches, stomachache, vomiting, and can last as long it takes for your body to clear all the serotonin. I also don't take it at night as jaw clenching can be bad at night, sometimes even at my low dosage.

reviewer_info: Jess, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment:
I have suffered depression since my teens, and have various & severe mental illness throughout my entire family history. I have been on and off antidepressants for years, but nothing has ever 'worked'. I would give up on them after a few months, until things got absolutely unbearable again & would finally drag myself off to the doctors to try another one. Even St Johns Wort had awful effects, and I essentially got to the point of accepting my perpetual unhappiness, and considering suicide as inevitable & the only option for future relief. 
Until.... 5-htp. 
I am extremely aware that everyone reacts differently to different chemicals, but for me, it has been a godsend. I take 2 x 100 casuals at night, and from day 3 onward, I have literally never felt better.
 I sleep, have lovely calm dreams (as apposed to constant nightmares), wake up energised & I am happy & completely at peace. 
I have suddenly & completely gone off sugar, and although I am not overweight, I have lost 3 kilos in 2 weeks. 
This would actually be my only warning; if you are someone who struggles to gain & retain weight, I would be careful on 5-htp & force yourself to eat, even if you don't want to. 
Other than that, I have had a 100% positive experience with no side effects whatsoever, & I would encourage anyone who has depression to give this supplement a chance.

reviewer_info: 5htplover, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Consumer)
comment:
I have been on 5-HTP for nearly 8 years, and much happier for it. I started it after my boyfriend died unexpectedly and I fell into a severe depression (normally I suffer from mild depression). I didn’t have insurance, and started researching alternatives to SSRIs. I had taken Zoloft for a spell years ago and it worked for me okay (though I didn’t like the side effects). The day I started taking it it worked! I was able to get out of bed and do the dishes, a major accomplishment at that time in my life. Over time and with an increased dosage, my depression and anxiety lifted and my concentration and focus improved. It also helped my sleep, and I didn’t experience a decreased libido like I did on Zoloft.

My advice:

1) Work with your doctor if you want to try this. Do not take 5-HTP with other meds unless instructed by your doctor as this can cause bad interactions (e.g., see #3 -serotonin syndrome).

2) Start with a low dose and work your way up. I started with 50 mg. Over time I upped it by 50 mg increments until I found what worked for me (150 mg once a day). 

3) Serotonin Syndrome (where getting too much serotonin is toxic) is real, but from what I have read you have to take 300 mg or more before you see toxic effects. This information may change over time as research teases this out, and I suspect it differs depending on the person. 

4) Take an enterically-coated version of 5-HTP. This means it breaks down in the intestine and not the stomach. After a year or so of taking uncoated pills, I started to experience stomach rumbling and discomfort, and a low-grade fever. The enteric pills eliminated this issue. 

5) Get a good quality product to ensure you are getting a pure product. I take Solaray. 

6) If it makes you sleepy, take it at night. I initially tried it on a Saturday day, when I knew I’d have the day off and could see how it made me feel. It made me drowsy. I now take it ~45 minutes before bed and that’s worked well for me.

comment: I've taken both benzos and SSRI's/SNRI's for panic disorder off and on during stressful times for years.  Just recently, I weaned myself off of Pristiq 50 mg because of the usual side effects (fatigue/feeling like a zombie/apathy) after taking it for 3 years. I will NEVER take a prescription med for anxiety again - it's like poison in your body as far as I'm concerned.  (good old big pharma)..

reviewer_info: Clarity, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Consumer)
comment: This comment is for those of you who eventually get side effects.  If you are experiencing anxiety, mind racing, etc after being on 5-htp, this is often the symptoms of serotonin syndrome. It means you do not need that much.  Some of these doses are crazy.  You should also drink green tea eith your 5-htp to protect your arteries (theoretical side effect).  A side BENEFIT of green tea is that it has theanine which will increase other brain chemicals that might be low.  I suffer from moderate to severe depression at times, and can only 50 mg for about 3-4 days before I start suffering from anxiety.  Then I'm good for weeks.  Take your 5-htp...not too much...for whatever amt of days. As soon as you start getting s/e's, this is your threshold. Do not take again till the benefits wear off.  You'll have to play around with this.  I suspect some people may be more sensitive due to various reasons. Maybe even methylation problems.  Also remember serotonin ain't the only kid on the block. If it doesnt work, you may need help with another brain chemical, or multiple.  Be well and God bless.

reviewer_info: SaneAgain, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment:
taken for long period of time with a few breaks.   Take daily for anxiety.   WATCH YOUR DOSAGE!!!   I cut a 100 mg tab into quarters and take only 1 daily, with very rare taking 2, so that is only 25mg daily normally.    Great treatment, but the dosage may be what causes so many of the problems people describe.   Who ever said that 100mg was a 'correct' dosage so that so many people take it as a minimum??!!??    And taking multiple dosages, or multiple times daily....talk about too much of a good thing!!!   Get a pill cutter, or split your capsules.  

I can feel the impact of the treatment within 10-20 min, calming my anxiety.    I usually take around noon.   Have GAD and have had panic attacks.    Xanax was horrible.  Dropped it quickly....thank God.   Since starting this 5htp treatment, and taking some GABA only at bedtime which I added to the mix about a year ago, no panic attacks at all.  Anxiety, but no panic.    

I do take 10-15mg amitryp at bedtime, which is a VERY SMALL dose, not therapuetic accoridng to Doc, but am very careful still with 5htp and the ami.    Never taken together at same time or too close together.   

I would recommend 5htp without reservation for anxiety, but at a smaller, more controlled, dosage.

reviewer_info: southcalmed, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Consumer)
comment: This treatment really helped with my anxiety. It also help me with my weight. I'm 19 and it helped me lose 40lbs over 6 months. As for the toxicity described above: The use of L-Tryptophan as a dietary supplement was discontinued in 1989 due to an outbreak of eosinophilia-myalgia syndrome (EMS) that was traced to a contaminated synthetic L-Tryptophan from a single manufacturer. Because of its chemical and biochemical relationship to L-Tryptophan, 5-HTP has been under vigilance by consumers, industry, academia and government for its safety. However, no definitive cases of toxicity have emerged despite the worldwide usage for the last 20 years. Extensive analyses of several sources of 5-HTP have shown no toxic contaminants similar to those associated with L-Tryptophan. Safety of 5-hydroxy-L-tryptophan. Toxicol Lett. 2004. (http://www.raysahelian.com/5-htp.html)

WebMD says not to take 5-HTP till more is known. However, the article is NOT dated! 
There was a scare about 5HTP in 1988 due to a contaminated batch from Japan, coming from the labs of Showa Denko caused 37 deaths and 1500 permanent disablements. 
Controversy at the time between big pharmas, the biotech and FDA resulted in a blanket ban of 5HTP. Pharmas would rather sell you the more expensive SSRI's. Biotech don't want you to know it was Genetic Engineering caused the problem. FDA played safe and banned everything just in case, or maybe under direction from lobbying by big P & BT.
User consensus says 5-HTP is very helpful, and videos on youtube from qualified professionals saying so. 
Me? I found it immensely helpful and get mine from a reputable source. 
If I hear that "voice of depression" I take 2 x 50mg tablets of 5 hydroxy tryptophan in the evening, it gives me a great night's sleep, possibly because it also converts to melatonin and significantly elevates my mood in the morning, presumably due to increased serotonin levels. 
I wish WebMD would update their statement to "avoid" this very helpful food supplement, and stop misleading people who need help, but they have not responded to my attempts to contact them with links about the original 5HTP contamination. 
Don't cross medicate with SSRI's or MAOI's and it is probably perfectly safe. 
Look up Tryptophan poisoning on google for yourself.

reviewer_info: 55-64 Female  (Caregiver)
comment:
WARNING:  Too many people here describe taking 5HTP with antidepressants.  DO NOT DO THIS.  It can cause serotonin syndrome which is often FATAL.

PLEASE read all the information and talk to your doctor before you use supplements.  http://www.drugs.com has a drug interaction checker that includes supplements.

reviewer_info: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment: I have been using 5 HTP for about a year, and the benefits have been amazing!!!  I've always been prone to depression, both genetically and environmentally. The Celexa and Prozac both worked well for about 6 months, and then tapered off.  Increasing the dose had the same effect after a few months.  I weaned myself off the Prozac (with my doctor's approval) during the spring and summer months, and found that with the use of 5 HTP I didn't need to go back on it in the fall for seasonal affective disorder.  At one point I was out of my 5 HTP supplement for about a month, and EVERYONE noticed how much my moods were affected!!!  I felt exhausted, miserable, angry and sad, like having permanent PMS!!!  Within a week of returing to my regular 5 HTP doe, I felt so much better and more in control of my emotions.  I felt normal!!!  This supplement has really been a God-send for me and my loved ones.  It feels great to not be on any antidepressant meds, and to feel good about myself not requiring the medication anymore.  I strongly urge anyone who has depression issues to look into 5 HTP therapy.  It can be used in conjunction with some traditional medications, but you need to check with your doctor.  Please do your research prior to taking any supplement.  I have nothing but good things to say about 5 HTP.  It was definitely the best thing I have ever done for myself (and my husband appreciates it, too!!!).

reviewer_info: on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
comment: Caffeine withdrawal can produce moderate to severe headaches accompanied by nausea and dizziness, lasting over 12 hours.  The headache usually appears 1 to 2 days after suspended use.  These symptoms can be treated with a dose of caffeine eliminating them within 10 minutes.  This is why headache preparations with caffeine are so effective while pure aspirin provides no headache relief from a caffeine withdrawal headache.  Those sensitive to caffeine may experience a caffeine withdrawal headache with the consumption of a single cola soft drink.  The 1 to 2 day delay of the headache makes it hard to associate the cause and effect.

reviewer_info: Tim, 55-64 Male  (Consumer)
comment: All caffeine drinks are not equal. Not including simple mixes such as soda, or "Red Bull" like drinks which add caffeine, drinks like Tea, Coffee, and Chocolate (Cocoa) are for the most part derived from simple beans. Because beans haven't begun development yet they contain primarily simple compounds. Tea however is derived from a leaf. Leaves are complex factories that produce hundreds of compounds... one of which is Theanine. This compound counters the bad effects of Caffeine (more or less depending on leaf content). As a result Tea should be considered different from other drinks. Also if consumed as a whole leaf either steeped multiple times (Chinese method known as Gongfu) Tea  provides huge doses of antioxidents with decreasing levels of Caffeine allowing Tea to “Wake you in the morning, keep you throughout the day, and put you to sleep soundly at night.” This due to decreasing Caffeine, and the “soporific” (sleep inducing) effect of  Theanine.

reviewer_info: Brandon, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Consumer)
comment:
Clearly this is a drug we all love, and love to hate. I think it speaks for itself. I was told by my gasterointerologist that it is a great laxative. Just a word to the weary about that, I'm not sure how accurate the side effects page on this is listing diarrhea as a "rare" side effect, but I suppose the days where insomnia is your only company and the next day of work mocks you for it, on those days it's worth putting up with the less than pleasant side effects for the ability to stay up and get the job done. Just remember to back off the stuff when your hands start shaking, figure out how long it takes to get through your system and space out the caffeine in those intervals to avoid overdose. for me it's about 2-3 hours. Body weight plays a factor, I happen to be a lean man in his mid 20's, so you may have separate circumstances. It is easy to build up a tolerance similar to alcohol requiring substantially more to get the same effect. This also creates a chemical dependency that can cause migraines when your brain is deprived of it. I avoid this by putting up with the migraines for a few days and avoid caffeinated food and supplements for up to 3 months. After that time I generally have brought my brain's chemical dependency to next to nil and my tolerance back down to healthier levels.

Always in moderation, and remember, never do any physically demanding activities when you've taken caffeine, it reduces lung capacity and robs your muscles of nutrients causing them to fatigue very fast under strain. You can create heart problems if you are under it's effects and subject your heart to too much strain, your base heart rate is already elevated and the extra strain can be painful to endure.

reviewer_info: teedee, 25-34 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: I was suffering with IBS- Diarrhea- urgency about 5 times a day. It got to the point where I would think I needed to fart but diarrhea would come out- As an adult this was unacceptable. I am completely "potty trained" and I have children. I did some research and self diagnosed with IBS- Literally constant diarrhea and it was always connected directly to time limits. If I needed to be somewhere at a certain time- as soon as the time was approaching- I would have diarrhea. Every day all day. I tried a walgreens and started looking up natural remedies and the first thing I Found was a green box IBS GARD With green capsuls containing pepermint oil beads. I was reluctant and sceptical but I was so tired of the literal shhh* that I would try anything. The packaging states to allow 24 hrs to kick in and also states to take 1-2 daily. I took one and noticed right away the calming effects. You might burp a little peppermint type burp, This is considered normal per the packaging instructions. I have take maybe three- five capsuls in this three week period since I bought the package and it makes the diarrhea go away for a day or two. Initially you might want to proceed with caution as you do not want to end up constipated for two days so start small. start with one. It really helped I am so thankful , I do no go anywhere without this, such a remarkable difference. I am so happy I can fart in ease and I do not run to the bathroom everytime I eat. I would recommend this to anyone with constant stress and diarrhea

reviewer_info: Barry, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)
comment:
It's been a long time since I made the post about having a heart attack after using Aloe Gel Caps for 3 years. An interesting development has occurred. 

My wife continued taking aloe gel caps, in September of 2012 she had a blocked artery in the exact same spot as mine in the R Coronary Artery at 59. She stopped taking it too now. She didn't have a heart attack, did have chest pains bad enough to go to the hospital 3 times. The 1st 2 times they missed the blockage with CT Scan, ECG, Stress Test, blood work. The 3rd time they did a heart cath and found this 99% blockage. The Cardio said she was in the 11th hour, ready to have a massive heart attack. She came home 3 days later with a stent in the exact same spot as mine.

Was it the Aloe? My wife took it for 4 years or more and grabbed her chest. I took it 3 years or more and grabbed my chest. Could be a coincidence, but somehow I will always wonder. The Cardio has told us to never take it again.

If you were my Wife, Dad, Mom, Brother or Sister, I would tell you not to risk it. It did a wonderful job of clearing up my Psoriasis and even dandruff, still gotta wonder if it almost killed us both. Use it topically. 

I wonder why there aren't long term studies of these herbs.

reviewer_info: AJ, 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment: Been a quality of life saver! Developed peripheral neuropathy in my feet due to years of abusing alcohol during all of my 20s and most of my 30s. The burning was so bad I couldn't wear shoes, had to fill the tub with cold water before I showered, and had to have a fan blowing on my feet at almost every waking and sleeping moment. I dreaded summertime as the pain was manageable in the cooler/cold months. Prescriptions wasn't an option for me because of the horrible side effects, so I turned to supplements. With months of research, I have found a combination of ALA, vitamin b complex, magnesium, and acetyl l-carnitine, taken for a little over a year has dropped my pain level from a 7 or 8 to a 2 or 3. Even some days I don't even notice when before it was on my mind every waking moment. Nerve regeneration takes time so don't expect immediate results. Be patient and lay off the booze ;)

reviewer_info: Kenny, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment:
I should have written this a long time ago.Alpha-Lipoic-Acid (ALA) has been a miracle for me. I am a mid 50 year old male. I have peripheral nueropathy. I was a professional musician most of my life and my neurolgist says my pn is likely a by product of too much sex, drugs and rock n roll ;-) Seriously though, she thinks 6 (alcohol) drinks a night for 30 years with a few other things here and there is the contributing factor (I quit everything 3 years ago). 

Anyway, my feet would hurt so bad, especially at night I couldn't sleep. I was wearing special shoes. Walking was painful. I used all the lidocaine and capsaicin creams and sprays. I tried a TENS unit. My Dr put me on Gabapentin (yuck). Someone in the waiting room at the Dr. office suggested ALA.

NO BS.... I noticed a difference after the first week. 1600 mg/day. Within a month probably @ 50? improvement (I quit taking Gabapentin at this point). 3 months saw @ 90% improvement (dosage here was reduced to 1200 mg/day). 6 months @ 95? better (dosage reduced to 800mg/day).

After just over a year at a dose of 800mg/day my pn is (depending on the day) between 98%-100% gone!!!! It is summer of 2016 and I have spent a significant amount of time walking around barefoot outdoors. I can wear any shoe I want, even my footwear of choice, cowboy boots. I even got my first ever pedicure a couple weeks ago. 

You have nothing to lose, so try it, I sure hopes it does for you what it did for me. Probably the only reason I am taking the time to write this is that after it was recommended to me in that Dr. office I reseached ALA and these reviews made me decide to give it a try. I hope you find relief and pain free days. Peace, Kenny

reviewer_info: researcher, 65-74 Female
comment:
To Reviewer: Johnny_Dee, Male (Consumer) 
Who asked how can you tell if ALA is working.
1) Monitor your blood sugar for a week WITHOUT the ALA.
2) Take ALA as suggested for a week and monitor your blood sugar.
See if your blood sugar has gone down or if any of your symptoms are better (though it's too early to really tell but some people actually get early results)
3) Keep taking ALA til the bottle runs out.
Check your blood sugar levels til ALA runs out. 
If A) Your blood sugar levels go down, then the ALA is working.
B) If your blood sugar doesn't go down BUT you see improvement in any of your symptoms,
continue with the ALA. Check to see how long it's safe to take ALA. Keep taking ALA for as long (length of time) as said to be safe.
Hope this helps those who want to know.

reviewer_info: Vitameatavegamin, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Consumer)
comment: I've used both A-lipoic and R-lipoic (stabilized) for purposes of general well-being. When first using it, it has a more powerful and noticeable effect, where I wake up in the morning feeling very peaceful and refreshed compared to usual. Eventually, if I keep taking it, it has a lot less of that effect. I take breaks from it for a few weeks after using it nightly for a few months to a year, because of a concern that it competes with the B-vitamin biotin, which has strong value for one's health. I take biotin every day earlier in the day away from the lipoic. I have tried using lipoic in conjunction with heavy metal detox protocols (modified citrus pectin and/or chlorella and/or cilantro in my green veggie juices, etc.) because the research behind that is, as I understand it, quite sound and convincing if done the right way. Should not be used too early in the program if one is definitely laden with mercury, because it can mobilize Hg in a way that it may bring more INTO the brain instead of removing it. For that purpose, should be used after a lot of whole body Hg detox has taken place first over a long period of time, and THEN use it every 3 hours I believe (might have been 2.5) to help remove some mercury. I confirmed higher Hg levels in urinalyses when doing this.

reviewer_info: zhooom, 45-54 Male  (Consumer)
comment:
You don't realize the benefit after a while - until you don't have it.

I've been taking R-Alpha Lipoic Acid, from Jarrows, for quite some time for type 2 diabetes and diabetic neuropathy.  Recently a mix-up occurred and I wasn't putting it with my daily pills.  I also use a fentanyl duragesic patch and a strong hydromorphone dose for breakthrough pain for this and other issues.  

I have a LOT of prescriptions to manage, so missing one pill is easy.  I had to take more and more hydromorphone to get any relief from my neuropathy, which was unusual, but a few hours later I'd be hurting again.  After a couple weeks I was literally starting to get desperate so we went through my pills and found the missing bottle of Alpha Lipoic Acid.  I took a couple that morning, and I was back to normal by the afternoon!

Now don't get it in your head that if you take it just when you have a neuropathy flare-up that you will get instant improvement -- maybe it helped me so fast since I took it for so long, but who knows.  I can't recommend it enough though -- strong painkillers barely helps neuropathy, but this stuff works fantastic.

I have no idea if it's true or not, but you should try and get the "active" version of Alpha Lipoic so that your body can use it immediately.  I use a 100 mg dose of the Jarrow R-ALA morning and evening for neuropathy, which runs me about $17 a month when I buy them from Amazon.

Seriously, try it.  Take it for a month and see if you notice your nerve pain go away.  If not, then stop taking it ... and see if you notice it then.  I sure as heck did...

Note that I can't find Jarrow Formula's on the product brand, but hopefully the one I chose is close enough.  Search Amazon for Jarrow Formulas R-Alpha Lipoic Acid and that should do it too.

reviewer_info: Tiffany, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment:
I used apple cider vinegar for a sinus infection in fall of 2012.  I both drank it and also mixed it in a distilled water dilution that I used with a neti pot to try to clear out my sinuses.  NEVER do this.  It introduced anaerobic organisms from the fermentation of the vinegar to my inflamed swollen sinuses.  2 years later, I have constantly been dealing with the repercussions of that through hard to diagnose chronic rhinosinusitis. Only after 2 CT scans, several 'aerobic bacteria' cultures, surgery, allergy testing, and inhaled coricosteriods as well as oral corticosteriods did my physician figure this out.

Please save yourself thousands of dollars and Never Inhale Fermented Apple Cider Vinegar.  it is not safe or effective.

reviewer_info: Christmaself, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
I've been taking ashwagandha (600mg organic pills containing the root powder) daily in the morning for generalized anxiety, social anxiety, and to boost my thyroid. (Luckily my metabolism is low. If yours is naturally high, this plant may cause you trouble.) The dose on the bottle suggests twice a day, but I've read enough material stating an effective dose can be as low as 450 mg.
Immediately after taking the first dose I felt sleepy, but this only happened to me once. I have noticed that I have more energy (have started to exercise every other day), and work has been slightly more bearable. (the dose I am using takes the edges off my social anxiety, but I am still uncomfortable).  
My appetite has increased a little, but I haven't experienced any negative sexual side effects.
I am not sure if this was because of the medication, but the first week I also created a schedule for my self to ensure that I get my tasks, work and personal care done in a timely fashion.
I don't take any other medication, except an occasional vitamin pill to fill any holes in my vegetarian diet.

reviewer_info: BombardierBob, 45-54 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: I've been surprisingly pleased with Ashwagandha.  I had no expectations.  It was simply recommended to me, and I started taking it.  It has definitely aided in sleep. Before taking Ashwagandha, I would eat 2-3 times during the night.  Since getting it, I still wake during the night, but I no longer feel it necessary to eat.  Also, it appears to have stabilized my blood sugar levels during the day.  I have much less cravings for sweets.  As a result, I've been able to lose fat while maintaining muscle and strength.  Furthermore, it does appear to help with depression/anxiety.  Although I no longer take medication, I experienced greater results with Ashwagandha and GABA than I did with psychotropics.  Unlike some, I've experienced no negative side effects.

This past Monday was my day off so I thought I would give it another try, this time I took 1 table.  In two hours I was vomiting intensely again, basically in the same manner I did on December 6th.  I couldn't function for the next 4 hours.  I continued to vomit and feel very poor the rest of the day.  And today, two days later, i'm still not feeling 100 percent.   
So, I did some checking and according to the information I found, it can effect those who take Thyroid medications.  When I was a kid I had graves disease and had my Thyroid completely removed and I take the medication Synthyroid for that condition.   I'm guessing that that has something to do with the reaction I had???

comment: I have been using a standardized extract of ashwaghanda (Sensoril) for sleep.  Although it enhances sleep, I have found that I feel fatigued and spacey the following day.  I have eliminated other variables and it is clear that this is being caused by the Sensoril. The dose used was either 225 mg or 450 mg (8% withanolides).  I have not had this side effect from crude ashwaghanda powder;  however, it was not as useful for inducing sleep. My reaction may be atypical but users of concentrated, standardized ashwghanda preparations should be aware that some people may experience drowsiness and spaciness that takes a day to resolve.

reviewer_info: Savita, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
comment:
My mom was having hallucinations at night, little people, wild animals, the room was changing - all things that were real to her.  I give her 8 drops of Ashwagandha extract that I put into a shot glass with a tablespoon of water.  I get the organic extract at Whole Foods, Herb-Pharm brand works best.  I started her off with a few drops and added drops each night until she began sleeping through the night.  

My mom is able to distinguish between her dreams and reality.  She doesn't wake up screaming about things that she had been dreaming about.  During the day she doesn't hallucinate.  If she does hallucinate about people and wild animals or the room changing, she takes 4 pellets of a homeopathic remedy, Helleborus Niger 30 C.

We also changed her diet.  We've cut out gluten - wheat, rice, barley, rye and Oats.  We also cut out all plants of the deadly night shade variety - tomatoes, eggplant, peppers and potatoes.  

She excercises everday on a treadmill for 20 minutes at a slow speed.  

She plays piano and works on jigsaw puzzles.

Ashwagandha is helping my mom to have much better days and nights.  I am finally sleeping and have the energy to care for my aging mom during the day.

Best of all, my mom is home with me and out of a nursing home!

reviewer_info: Biotin ---Plus!, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment: I came back to add some more information about my experience with biotin and to urge all of you with thinning hair to try this treatment. It has been a life-changer for me. I no longer worry about whether my hair is arranged properly to cover all the balding areas, I no longer worry about going out in the wind or the rain or the sun -- all of which can reveal thinning hair. And, I look so much younger with a full head of hair. It really seems like a miracle, because now I have completely normally thick hair after having had badly thinning hair for approximately 45 years! Here is the additional information I wanted to share: (1) As I have continued to use biotin, my hair has continued to thicken and it just never seems to shed any more. (2) I use whatever kind of biotin is available, not necessarily a particular brand name. Lately, I have been buying "Nature's Bounty" from Sam's Club. (3) I take one (1) 10,000 mcg gelcap-type dose per day. (4) You must tell your doctor you are taking biotin -- make sure the information is entered on your chart, because the use of biotin can affect the results of your blood tests. I had told my doctor I was taking biotin and it was on my chart, but when I went in for my most recent physical and lab tests, the doctor called back and said my thyroid function looked a little off, which he said might have been due to the biotin, and he had me stay off the biotin for four (4) days and then come back in and take the test again (which was fine). So, do tell your doctor you are taking biotin, and lay off the biotin for several days before you go in for lab tests so you don't have to repeat the test the way I did. Anyway, I do urge you to try this stuff -- it truly is a miracle and has made me feel so much more confident about my appearance!

reviewer_info: 19-24 Female  (Consumer)
comment: Honestly as a young girl I always struggled with my hair growing, nails, everything, also, had a stage of alopecia at a time, anyways taking 10000 mg of biotin a day has really improved my hair my nails eyelashes everything I didn't even grow armpit hair before taking it and now I've had to shave that area which I never did before I really recommend it!

reviewer_info: Biotin ---Plus!, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Consumer)
comment: I have suffered thinning hair for many years. I have used Rogaine ever since it came out, but it did not thicken my hair much. I began taking Biotin about 6 months ago. For the first 3 months, I felt my hair was thickening, but only slightly. I figured I needed additional help so I began taking some of the supplements listed in the famous Bargello's Vitamin Regimen (Google it). I have taken a multivitamin for many years along with a Vitamin D supplement, so I added MSM, Evening Primrose, and Flaxseed Oil to my regimen. (No real science to my choice of products; I just went to Natural Grocers and stopped buying after my total reached $40.) I also added Vitamin B-12, based on some online reading. I have not added iron although some sources suggest it might be helpful. I have had no side effects at all, except -- about a month after adding the supplements, I experienced the worst shed of my life. My hair line receded (even more) and my hair thinned all over my scalp. With some careful teasing, artful arranging of the hair, generous application of Toppik, and lots of hairspray to keep everything in place, I was able to camouflage the shed enough to ride things out. It took about a month of misery and self-consciousness, but now my hair is growing in thicker than it has since I was a youngster! My hairline is filling in and there are no thin spots anywhere on my scalp, and the hair that is coming in is not the thin, fragile hair you get after your hair follicles have practically shut down, but robust medium-coarse hair and with no shedding to speak of -- I see only about 5 hairs in the sink after I comb my hair and arrange it, when I used to see at least 20-30. Honestly, it's as if the terrible hair shed I went through earlier was just this great new hair pushing the old stuff out of my follicles! It is SO GREAT having hair again! Try it for yourself!

reviewer_info: Lynn, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment:
I have taken low doses of Biotin for about 20 years; about 1,000/2,000 without any problems and great results.  After taking Wellbutrin for abouta year, I noticed gradual hair loss.  I stopped taking it and felt desperate to regain my thick hair.  I choose to buy Biotin 10,000 to speed up the process; big mistake!!!  Within a few months,  my scalp became itchy.  I sought treatment and help, but no doctor could determined be the cause.  I was told to use dandruff shampoo, which never helped.  A few months later, I began having itchy patches on my body; mainly my elbows, knees, low back, outter thighs and my stomach.  Again, I asked a few doctors for help and was told that I have Ecezma for the first time in my life.  I used the steroid cream without much relief, so began feeling hopeless and depressed.  The itching is so bad that I rarely get a good nights sleep.  

Long story short, I threw out all of my vitamins, thinking it had to be an allergic reaction to one of them.  The only one I kept was the biotin 10,000.  As my itching didn’t subside, I finally realized that it must be the biotin.  I did some on-line research and found that doses over 2,500 can cause skin eruptions, itchy rash and scalp!!!!  I have stopped taking it, and the it hi g is slowly becoming less severe.  I am truly hoping that gmo has only get better, as I have been determined to find the cause if my itching.  I have never had this issue before, and pray that I have found the reason.  So far, so good!!!  I can see that they don’t even list a Biotin 10,000 below, so picked Natures Bounty 5,000, so x2 a day!!!?? ugh!!!    I am just hoping that I can spare someone the anguish that I have endured.  More is definitely not better, and just because Amazon sells it doesn’t mean it’s safe.

I’ve tried like 4 different brands until i found that the best one for me. Now i’m 26 and I've been taking Biotin every day for years.  My hair and nails grow SO much quicker. Hair has increased in the rate and are so long now. 
Also my energy levels are high. I remember that at the beginning i did heavy cardio and interval training which helped me lose weight fast but i did not realize how biotin played a part in my weight loss until AFTER i stopped working out. I continue to take biotin every day and now that I am no longer on my diet i eat whatever i want and i don't gain weight. reviewer_info: 2BHealthy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
comment: Does it work overnight and produce miraculously lush, thick hair?  No.  But as a woman with thinning hair, a receding hairline in places and hair frankly just falling out rapidly due to meds I'm on... I'm very pleased with the turnaround.  I saw thin hairs begin to grow at my temples first, and eventually noticed my 'part' was less noticeable.  It's also nice to be able to want to wash my hair again and not feel like I'm accidentally removing all my hair.  My nails are a bit stronger too, although not a huge improvement, just a slight extra perk.  What I wasn't even aware is I'm borderline diabetic and perhaps this will help with that too.  Oh, I did try to stop taking it (i.e. forgot to repurchase when the bottle ran out) and saw the hair problems come back -- so I won't be stopping this vitamin again.  By the way, I chose Natrol 10,000mcg after doing research (which I see isn't on the list so I had to select their 1000mcg here).  From what I read it's not something you can really overdo.  It's also only 1x per day and a smooth round pill easy to get down.

reviewer_info: vanessam, 45-54 (Consumer)
comment:
Started taking biotin 5mg 4 weeks ago. My hair is slow growing anyway but after a disastrous hair cut, holiday abroad and over use of bleached highlights I was desperate. 4 weeks on I am over the moon with the results. My hair has definitely experienced improved growth (I know from my roots), is softer, shinier and overall in better health. Don't be misled though. . .I have done other stuff to assist such as using a pure coconut treatment twice a week, eating a diet rich in nutrients to support hair nails and skin, reducing my use of electrical appliances(I am a slave to my straighteners) and cutting down massively on alcohol and caffeine. Also, I recommend infusion pro vitamin b5 treatment to assist . . .won't make your hair grow but will make it feel fab. 
I did have to bite the bullet initially and have a good 2 inches taken off before I started this 'grow my hair healthily' journey. . .but I reckoned it was worth it. I have learnt there are no quick fixes . . . If you want long strong healthy hair you need to commit but I for one am up for it as I am already seeing the benefits!!! Good luck xxx

I FORGOT, i switched up the pill type and accidently kept taking 3-4 pillls (roughly between 15,000-20,000 mcgs). And I think I actually took 5 pills a few times. Well here recently, I have been experiencing severe breast tenderness outside of my cycle and mammary gland irritation. I put two and two together and just literally figured out today I have been overdosing for a couple weeks. The breast tenderness has stopped and I am alright now, but how scary is that?! I researched biotin toxicity, and couldnt find much info because the research is lacking, but I know FIRSTHAND that breast tenderness is a side effect when taken improperly (my fault). I am so scared now, I will probably refrain from taking it ever again. I wonder what long-term biotin does to the breasts...I'm done son. And I thank God for helping me to make this discovery.

reviewer_info: DebbieSWZ, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
I started taking 3,000 mcg of Biotin a day to help my nails get stronger almost a year ago (end of August ’09).  It worked!  However I started having pretty severe headaches from it.  At first I thought the headaches were related to something at work (the start of a new school year, as I work for the school district).  However, it finally occurred to me after about 2 ½ months of frequent severe headaches and asking myself if I had been doing anything differently or eating anything different to cause them, that MAYBE it was the Biotin causing it.  

Coincidentally, I had started taking the biotin right about the same time as the start of the school year.  I stopped taking the biotin as soon as it occurred to me that it might be causing the headaches.  My doctor was skeptical that it was the biotin, but thought perhaps it was the ‘delivery system’ (the other ingredients in the pill besides the biotin).  She also suggested it might take a few weeks to get entirely out of my system and she was right.  The headaches did start lessening immediately, though.  After about 4 weeks, I was back to having the occasional sinus headache or tension headache.  

Just to do an experiment and to test my doctor’s hypothesis that it might just be the delivery system, after 6 months off the biotin, I tried it again.  I tried a different brand that my friend swore was the answer to her weak, brittle finger nails – and it had 1,000 mcg of biotin in it.  I decided to take only one (when I had originally been taking 3,000 mcg) and SURE ENOUGH, THE NEXT DAY I HAD A SEVERE HEADACHE!  Again, it took a couple of weeks for the frequency of my headaches to go back down to normal even after only one dosage of 1,000 mcg.  

It’s funny, I researched biotin on so many different websites before I started taking it and there wasn’t one mention of side effects on any of them!  I hope my experience will help others who might have this same reaction.

reviewer_info: Surfrider, 65-74 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment: I had pre-diabetes with 6.1 A1C and 107 fasting blood sugar. After two years of eating a small piece of bitter melon fruit with each meal my AIC is 5.5 and fasting blood sugar is 98. Steady decline for both numbers over time. I buy the fruit at a Chinese grocery store. Cut it length wise into halves, scrape out the seeds, slice it into small pieces about 1/4 inch thick, microwave it for about 3 minutes (three medium size fruit)with some water in bowl. Spread it onto plates and place in freezer. When frozen, put in freezer zip lock bags and retrieve from freezer when time to eat. Not very tasty, but if frozen it is tolerable. Its a miracle food for me.

reviewer_info: NKumar, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: I would strongly advise all lactating mothers NEVER to take bitter melon by mouth. I did not know its side effects & have been consuming it for the last 4 weeks, thinking that it would help my general health & wellness, until I started noticing a drop in my milk production. I have been exclusively breast-feeding my 5 month old infant, and have been working full-time & pumping at work for the last 3 months. The drop in milk production was significant (went from 16oz a day, to 12oz, and then down to 9oz). And finally, I started my menstrual period. I know that there can be other factors that can cause breast-feeding mothers to start menstruating, but I have been breast-feeding my infant 8 times in 24 hours (including 2 pumping sessions). My experience cannot count as scientific proof, but I don't believe that its a coincidence, that my milk production drops, followed by menstruation, exactly after 4 weeks of consuming bitter melon. So if you, or anyone you know is nursing/pregnant then please advise not to eat this.

While taking this periodically for a year when I was 36 years old, it made me grow 1.5 inches taller, and it made me bigger boned and added a little muscle. reviewer_info: MommaJ64, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Consumer)
comment: I have several issues CIDP (chronic inflammatory relapsing radicular neuropathy, Lyme disease, fibromyalgia, narcolepsy, gerd, and ibs. I've been sick my whole life although I look healthy. I had been receiving Gamunex (IVIG) treatments monthly for over 6 years to treat nerve damage that caused paralysis, and other health issues. It worked wonders and I could walk again. In 2010 I lost my job, therefore my health  insurance, and was no longer able to get my monthly infusions. I met a doctor that specializes in CIDP, whom suggested I try Colostrum. I started relapsing, so decided to try it. I have been taking 2 Colostrum capsules 650mgs daily for a year now. I am no longer on any prescription meds, only the occasional naproxen or Tylenol. I had walked with a limp since a crush injury in 1998, had severe sciatica in both legs, neuropathy pain in hands, feet, tongue, and head, RA pain in every joint. Since taking the Colostrum I no longer limp, I sleep better, and rarely feel any neuropathy pain or burning. I have more energy and no longer feel depressed. My digestive issues are no longer an issue. My RX induced HBP and high LDL have correct and are in healthy range again. And I am able to walk further and stand longer than I have in over 13 years. This stuff is great!!!
