reviewer_info: Deborah, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
After 17 years on Depakote, most "Doctors" had ignored my many symptoms. Medicals don't look at psych meds.  At last a great Doctor started me looking at deficiencies. Depacote caused 5 in me, including l-carnatine.  My period returned the day after I started it, but I have to increase it slowly, to keep everything balanced.  My thyroid levels went down, my mania went up, so I'm back on Lithium and increasing thyroid again.

But I had started dying. It's slow, but I can live and go back to work after 12 years.

I thought I needed more (I take a lot of Depakote!) but I will try taking it on an empty stomach first.  All this could have been spared if any of over ten docs or shrinks were aware of it!  I am so glad for this web site!

I'm using NOW's plain old L-Carnatine.  Weight loss would be nice, but I can do it on my own (I have) if I don't have ten deficiencies to fight with.

I suffered from chronic fatigue, insomnia and occassional stomach problems (all undiagnosed from my doctor).  After 1 week taking this stuff, I am sleeping 100% better, don't feel tired anymore and it has totally regulated my appetite (even my poop quality has been better).  This stuff has been great.  I don't know what exactly it does but I've tried a TON of other vitamins and supplements with no improvements.  L-Carnitine immediately helped with most of my issues, even when I didn't think they were related.  Now if it will only help give me a kid, I'll do a commercial for this supplement!  I'm taking 1000mg a day.

reviewer_info: refreshed1234, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment:
well, i am 45 now. i have been living with, i think, presbyopia. i have always been nearsighted, but since i turned 40, i noticed a sharp deterioration in focusing from seeing things up close to far away. for instance, my eyes cannot focus as they used to from looking at my smart phone to looking around the room. and doing so gives me a head ache. so i think this condition is presbyopia.
so i go to a vitamin store, the lady says to me, try this, a bottle of 40 mg lucien. i was skeptical, but i thought, what the heck, why not!?
so i took 1 tablet a day, i did notice a slight difference even after 1 week, but too slight to tell if the vitamin really worked or not. after week 3, yes, it really works! after looking at things near, such as my cell phone , and then looking up and around, my eyes focus, and i don't get a headache.
well so far so good. it is week 3. 40 mg might be a lot though, and i am not sure of the side effects. but that is what lucien has done for me.
by the way, this is an honest an honest review. i am a consumer, i am not being paid by anyone to write this.
i also take a tablet of vitamin a , but i don't think the vitamin a is what has improved my vision because i have taken vitamin a before with no showable effects.

comment: I purchased Bausch + Lomb Preservision Eye Vitamin AREDS 2 Formula Soft Gels  and  SIMPLY RIGHT, Wellness & Nutrition, Lutein & Zeaxanthin  (promotes eye and vision health)  at Sam's Club Store, El Camino location, Springfield, MO on Monday, December 2, 2013. The second product listed above, Lutein & Zeaxanthin, indicated on the orange and yellow box:  "25 mg of Lutein + 5 mg of Zeaxanthin", which is above the normal intake for most individuals according to online information I researched.  Also the box indicated:  "Pregnant or nursing women, individuals taking medications or persons who have a health condition should consult their physician before using this product."  I read this information on the box AFTER taking these 2 different softgels.  I will be returning these 2 items to Sam's Club due to the miserable side effects I experienced.

reviewer_info: fierce1, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
comment: I was taking a lutein supplement until my doctor set me straight.  He told me that lutein is one of three macular pigments, the other two being zeaxanthin and meso-zeaxanthin.  He told me that people get AMD by sunlight entering the eye and causing free radicals that over time lead to the disease.  The macula pigments are in the surface tissue, and protect the underlying tissue from damage from light, like a shield.  People with low macular pigment are more likely to get AMD.  He told me the pigments are arranged in a bullseye, with meso-zeaxanthin being at the center, zeaxanthin being in the next ring and lutein being in the outer ring.  We get lutein and zeaxanthin in our diet, but not meso.  our bodies convert lutein to mesozeaxanthin.  however, he told me that some people can not convert lutein to meso so they have a hole in their shield and it is right in the center where our best vision is!  so, you need all three pigments to have a healthy functioning shield.  he also told me that the macular pigments are antioxidants, with Mesozeaxanthin being the strongest, followed by zeaxanthin then lutein.  so the macular pigment serves two purposes, it blocks sunlight and for the light that does get through and forms free radicals, it neutralizes them by being antioxidants.  I think I have this straight, but my point is that if you only take lutein as I was, you are not protecting the most important part of the eye.  The supplement I now take is called Macuhealth and has all three pigments.

comment:
Before taking L-lysine from the NOW brand, I had been suffering from canker sores for the last 20 years on a very regular basis. My canker sore(s) would last for one week, maybe even two weeks. Anyway, I read that L-lysine could prevent canker sores from forming so I started taking one L-lysine 1000mg tablet from the NOW brand three times a day, mostly on empty stomach downed with a cup of water. comment:
40 years ago I was diagnosed with genital herpes while being pregnant.  This virus can be fatal to babies during birth should a lesion be present.

I have been taking lysine ever since.  My delivery was without lesions as I had repeated cultures taken prior to delivery.

I have had to increase my dosage over time.  Initially I was able to keep the virus dormant with only 500 mg.  When lesions erupted on that dose, I began with 500 mg twice a day.  Now, 40 years later, I am taking 1500 mg a day.

In my opinion, keeping the virus in a hostile environment due to higher levels of lysine than arginine, is much less intrusive than taking the prescribed anti-viral medicines over a lifetime.

comment: I dealt with horrible cold sores for many years on my lower lip.  Some were very inflamed, painful and puffed up.  This was extremely embarrassing when around coworkers especially after the TIME magazine article titled "The New Scarlett Letter" published in 1982.   No longer was it a simple cold sore since it became an STD called Herpes.  This was the center of conversation on the late night TV shows.  My dentist gave me a prescription for Denavir (Penciclovir Cream) which worked extremely well but at a cost of about $50 for a 2g tube (about 1 tsp).  Denavir did not decrease the incidence but it did lessen the severity IF I applied it at the first tingling sensation.   I have since discovered the L-Lysine treatment and I have not had a serious outbreak for the past five years.  At the most I have one or two possible outbreak per year.   I call them possible because taking Lysine 1000 mg 3 times a day for three days prevents it from developing fully so it could have been just a cracked dry lip.

reviewer_info: Mai, 45-54 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)
comment:
I am 49 y/o and I have had cold sore outbreaks ever since my beloved mother gave me a kiss on the mouth when she had a cold sore outbreak when I was 16 years old. Three weeks later I got my first cold sore and I've had them every winter ever since. 

Winter 2015 I finally figured out that my outbreaks were due to the cold snaps we get living in Florida. 

I realized that when it starts to get cold (below 50°) my lips will start to feel like a prune and NO amount of lip moisturizing helps.

 I finally realized it was the cold snaps that was changing my pH balance and breaking me out in cold sores . It took me till I was literally this age of 49 to figure this out . 

I just figured cold Soares was something I would have to live through every winter which I have until 2015.

 During the summer when I never have outbreaks because my lips are moist I started taking small doses of lysing (500 mg) and also for the first time started taking biotin for "hair skin and nails" (one maximum dosage daily tablet 10k mcg).

I took these two over-the-counter medicines religiously every day starting September 2016... Just before the cold season hit . I do not take them during the spring and summer because I don't breakout.

 Whenever the cold snaps DID occur I IMMEDIATELY UP my l-lysine to 3x a day ... Usually blended into my smoothies so I couldn't taste it at all... 1000 mg (yup!) each serving... morning noon night . Sometimes I even did it four times a day. (I got this 3k - 4k MG dosage idea from a holistic website).

 When the cold snap ended I DROPPED the dosage of l-lysine (any brand you want)  to normal 500 mg. 

Also Biotene is taken every day year-round with my regular vitamin supplements . If I felt like it during a cold snap I might take biotin morning and night with my l-lysine smoothie :)

 Lip moisturizers don't keep you from breaking out. This is my second year and I have had ZERO outbreaks it's awesome. Finally!!!!! L lysine and biotin.

reviewer_info: Alabama Al, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment: I am 79 and I have had the problem from as far back as I can remember. At first all we had was Campho phnique (misspelled and useless) Then there was an article in Readers Digest about L-Lysine. For several months or maybe a year no drug store had any, way too much demand. Then there was no instructions on how much to take. Since this wasn't studies by drug companies but trial and error by each person. Here is what I have found that works extremely  well every time. First I have found that I have no problems with taking large doses, it just works quicker.  ALWAYS have a bottle handy, speed is important. I keep a bottle at home, at my office, AND  in my car. The MOMENT I feel one start, I take a dose.  A DOSE is 6 of the 500 mg size pills.  Put 1 on each side back on back teeth, crunch them up, almost no taste, makes them faster acting, drink lots of water. remember, 6 crunched up pills per dose.  Within 15 minutes you no longer feel the blister.  AGAIN the moment you feel the blister again, take another dose. It may be in an hour or two, BUT the moment you feel it, take another full dose. Go by the feel of the blister only. If you can feel it after 15 or 20 minutes, take another dose. When done this way, I can totally whip an attack, and no one else can even see where the blister was starting. There is nothing to heal, its over and all gone.  If they are coming again and again, after I whip it I take 1 or 2 tablets morning and night. I think I could take 1 pill per day and would never have an attack, But I only take them when I feel them coming. After reading this and thinking of people I have told about it, somehow many don't take enough or often enough. They still say that it helped. Another thing, Some called them cold sores and canker sores. I don't know if it is the same problem but it seems that the same solution might work. I sure wish I could get some feedback but that is not the way it is set up.  Good luck.

reviewer_info: CaliGurrrl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: I woke up Tuesday, Sept. 8th with a cold sore (I know need to pay closer attention to the early warning signs so this doesn't happen all the time) - But anyway, I took 1000mg of L-Lysine in the morning and put Lysine cream directly on the sore, but it still spread. I took 1000mg of L-Lysine that night, and again the next morning and so on. Not sure if it helped, but I also applied Abreva for the itching and pain periodically throughout the day (about every 3 hours or so). As a side note, my last cold sore lasted close to 3 weeks even though I used Abreva early on; it seemed to almost make the sore worse, but I can't say for sure. So by Thursday, Sept. 10th, the sore was crusting, and today, Friday, Sept. 11, it's completely scabbed over. I anticipate it will we gone completely by Sunday (& I'm still taking the Lysine 2X/day). For me, that time frame is remarkable since my cold sores usually last at least 10 days! I seem to get them during high stress times, and they seem to be triggered by getting my upper lip threaded (it's like waxing but with thread); it's also currently right around menstruation for me (horrible timing for sure). At first these things only popped up every few years, but now it seems like I get them at least once a year, but this will be twice this year. I read about L-Lysine pills after my last 3-week bout, and I think they DEFINITELY increased the healing time immensely! Sometimes the sores are so painful and spread to the top and bottom of my lip (I get them on the corners of my mouth, making it hard to open my mouth without it splitting), but this time it didn't spread that far - I'd like to attribute that to the Lysine pills. As far as side effects, I didn't notice any, and I'm sensitive/paranoid about all medication/supplements. Some people recommend 1000mg 3X/day but I didn't want to do that  personally. I'd say try the L-Lysine at the very least, it's so cheap (I bought Spring Valley brand at WalMart). Hope this helps someone!

reviewer_info: Barbiebabe, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment: I have had cold sores on my mouth for 20+ years. Stress, the sun, certain foods like chocolate, jello, alcohol, all seem to bring out the sores. Yes, I try to eat food rich in lysine like dairy etc. But it wasn't enough so I had to take supplements too. So I take 6 lysine tablets 1000mg each as a daily regimen. I do believe my body has gotten used to them that I sometimes think they have become ineffective. I have stopped taking them a couple of years ago but that didn't help either. So I'm back on them. I still get frequent breakouts, mostly small ones, occasionally I get a bad out break (once or twice a year now). I do think this treatment works, but it works differently in everybody and it was interesting to read everyones experiences.  According to what I have read lysine should be taken on an empty stomach so I take 3 pills when I get up in the morning and 3 pills before I go to bed. I keep my lips hydrated constantly (I'm the chap-stick, carmex, super lysine Queen!). And I avoid chocolate as best I can. I feel chocolate is a big culprit for these sores since its very high in arginine which is known for facilitating an outbreak. reviewer_info: Ren, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: I have had cold sores since I was 6 months old. They are awful and painful. I was having breakouts all the time for the last two years, every two weeks or so. Two nights ago, my third cold sore in three weeks appeared and my fiance's dad happened to have  some lysine lying around. I was feeling rather miserable and desperate so I took it. The next morning the huge blister was reduced to a tiny speck of a blister. I have been taking 1000 mg at bedtime/day since and will continue to do so. Today the pinhole sized blister is nearly healed. I estimate approx. one more day until it is gone. Compared to the usual 5-8 plus way more pain, etc. I was on Valicyclovir for a year two years ago and used it as a suppression therapy. Lysine seems to be just as effective so far with fewer negative side effects. Seems like a good deal to me. I have been plagued with them all my life and it seems like I might finally get some relief (I also avoid sun, wind, dehydration, lack of sleep, and stress and perform lip care several times daily). I have also been very stressed lately and noticed that the last few days my mind is sharper and I am feeling moderately calmer.

comment: I have suffer from acute ongoing headaches and fatigue for 60 years (yes!) probably caused by a strange combination of having had Chicken Pox (Zoster Virus) as a child and almost simultaneously suffering a cracked skull in a motor accident. I also had shingles when I was 63 years old and went into semi-retirement soon afterwards. Interestingly, the feeling of fatigue and the headaches continued. I wondered why. The medical profession seemed unable to help. Nothing worked. Eventually, I was given 10 1000mg tablets to try out. Brilliant. Brilliant. Brilliant.  The pain subsided to almost zero as did the fatigue.  Now, why did I have to suffer needlessly for all those years when a simple dose of 1000mg daily would have solved the problem. reviewer_info: ftannie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment: Since I was a child I have suffered with cold sores. As a teen monthly cycles made them break out, continuing into adulthood. It has been a constant battle in my life, and outbreaks came with lethargy followed by depression. I found lysine in my late 20s and was beyond happy,as it worked for many years. As I aged through menopause, the virus moved from cold sores on my lip to my gums, and the doctor prescribed Acyclovir. I had never taken a prescription for this and it was effective, but outbreaks were constant. The doctor prescribed taking it daily along with medicine for depression. The virus then rapidly moved along my nerves to my ear canal, then my sinus and behind my eyes causing violent headaches. It was debilitating, and it seemed like the medicine was pushing it deeper into my system. During this time, frantic for relief and concern for my eyesight, I learned that my extremely healthy diet - nuts, grains,etc., was food heavy in arginine that was actually stimulating the virus in my system. Even the protein powder I used for workouts was high in arginine. Immediately I changed my diet to remove all foods high in arginine, added any foods with lysine, and got back to taking lysine supplements, stopped the antidepression and Ayclovir medicines. The virus went into remission "overnight" and the depression lifted as quickly, life is normal after almost two years of horrible pain. So thankful for bloggers sharing their stories, never would have known my healthy nutrition was the culprit, so off balance for my body.

reviewer_info: Polly, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment: I have suffered very miserably with cold sores on my lips and face since being kissed as a baby on the forehead by an infected person. Taking one 500mg lysine tablet a day every day has reduced the number of outbreaks to about one a year, and reduces the extent and invasiveness of outbreaks. reviewer_info: PasteyKid, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment:
Honestly the best treatment I have found is 4000MG x 3 times a day orally. Drink lots of water, but the less food the better.

I have created a paste also using 1000mg pills in a small bowl with only Hydrogen proxide. Let it sit for about 20 minuts sir occasionally. Optionally you can blend the bills in a blender. But do NOT put the hydrogen peroxide in the blender. The Peroxide eats away any rubber sealings within two uses. Found out the hard way don't do it. 

And mix it in a bowl with a few ounces of hydrogen peroxide and let it sit for a little bit. Those pills don't break down easily. 

Once it is about the consitancy of milk, (there will still be big chunks of pill unless you blended it), put it all over the area infected, I myself have had it spread to my neck and check and shoulders. Leave it on for a LONG time. I leave mine on and put more coats on when it drys. Usually 2-3 coats per hour. It does hurt a bit as it tighten the skin underneath, giving sharp pulls like band aids if over joints. 

Once it completely drys out, you will be covered in white powder that was not absorbed. It will flake off in powder form. If you really want to you can try and save the powder if you have a thick coat, and use it again.

It's amazing how well it works, it turns white headed breakouts into faint red dots, not even bumps. After doing this two days, with 2-3,1 hour sessions a day, my extremely bad breakout was only little red dots.

Any ones that are left still large, Just keep using the treatment on them. I just keep doing all of the previously infected areas even if they are clear, can't be to careful it will spread or reappear. If they are very large I usually try to pop them and let them weep just a little bit, and then massage the solution into the affected area.

Word of caution, if you use your bare-hands to apply this to affected area, your hands will become very coarse from the peroxide.

Im currently writing this with the solution on myself

reviewer_info: BeTheLove, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment:
I am 5' 9" tall, 140 pound female. This is what I do AS SOON as I feel a sore comming on, it's usually gone in a few days to a week and never gets big enough for other people to notice. 
Day 1:
At first sign of cold sore I take 3,000mg of L-Lysine with either an 8oz glass of milk or a calcium suppliment as I was advised Calcium helps your body absorb and distribute the Lysine. 
Then using 1/8 to 1/4 inch slice of a FRESH live Aloe Vera plant and apply it topically to the cold sore. After that it's smooth sailing, I just take 1,000mg between each meal of the day with a glass of milk, and once more before bed. I apply the Aloe topically as needed and drink lots of water, through out the day. 

Day 2,3,4:
I take 1,000mg with water first thing in the morning, between each meal of the day, and once more before bed. I apply the Aloe topically as needed and drink lots of water, through out  the day.

Day 5: 
I follow Day2,3,4's steps until I can feel the worst is over. Then I taper off to 1,000 mg twice a day, for two days in a row. Usually by then it's practically healed and no longer requires Lyzine. However if you feel like its starting to itch or burn again, keep following Day2,3,4's instruction until completely gone. 

**Please note:
Drink lots of water to prevent Lysine toxication (as I was advised it can cause renal failure) but also water helps your body properly utilize the Lysine. Through my own trial and error I learned processed/pre-packaged Aloe Vera products & gels do NOT work, it must be a piece from a fresh live plant. This will alleviate the itching and burning, plus keeps the cold sore from growing bigger and helps to deflate any swelling or puffiness of the affected area. Keep some fresh Aloe with you and apply topically AS SOON as you start to feel any itch, tingle, or burning.

comment: I have had genital herpes for 3 years and I have been taking 1000mg of Lysine daily after it was recommended to me by a friend. I have been taking Lysine as a suppressive therapy for about 2 1/2 years and I have only had one full fledged outbreak since then. If I feel one beginning, I increase my dose to about 3000mg a day, which has prevented lesions from forming every time but the one. Lysine has been effective for me and is much more affordable than Valtrex - especially if you buy it in bulk from sites like puritan.com. I would like to see more clinical studies on Lysine's effect on genital herpes specifically and any side effects or long term effects it may have. So far, I have not noticed any negative effects.

comment: I use to get 3-4 cold sores a year.  Doesn't sound like much but when you get them they really suck.  My loser doctor prescribed Valtrex at $5/pill. Anyway, I would take the $5 pill and then again 12 hours later (another $5) and I would wake up with a cold sore every damn time.  I did this for about a year with absolutely no success.  I read on here about L-Lystine.  So I tried it.  When I felt a cold sore coming on I would take a pill, 1000mg.  about $.12 ea.  99% of the time the tinging went away within 12 hours and now I might get a cold sore every 18-24 months (usually when I am really stressed out) it's 1/4 of the size if it comes out at all and is completely gone within 1-2 days.  Amazing!  I don't take Lystine daily for fear of building up an immunity.  And I think it would bother my stomach.  I only take it when I feel like I might get a cold sore.  Like I said, this method works 99.9% of the time.  I'm still pissed at my doctor for not mentioning Lystine.

reviewer_info: MichSki, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Consumer)
comment:
I will start by saying I am medically a bit weird. That being said, I take magnesium as needed for difficulty with concentration, anxiety, fatigue, and muscle weakness. I am diagnosed with polyendocrine issues related to autoimmune dysfunction, am in remission for myasthenia after a thymectomy, have PCOS, mild diabetes, and am subclinical but being monitored for Hashimoto's and Cushings. I have mild to moderate incontinence, and was told the magnesium might help with that as well...

That being said, I ONLY take my magnesium supplement when the symptoms I noted above (except the incontinence) become almost disabling, because of a horrible side effect - I feel such strong urinary urges that I feel like I have a UTI, my kidneys ache, and my bladder cramps, all on the day after I take a magnesium tablet. I drink extra water to try to alleviate some of it, with minimal results.

My supplement isn't in the list below - Nature's Bounty 500 mg high potency Magnesium.

I do not know if this is related to my genetics, the autoimmune situation specifically, or of it is something else. I wanted to bring it up here because I'm baffled by its usage as a urinary tract relaxant. That is not my experience.

reviewer_info: silver, 45-54 Female  (Consumer)
comment:
"The daily Recommended Dietary Allowances (RDA) for elemental magnesium are: Age 1-3 years, 80 mg; 4-8 years, 130 mg; 9-13 years, 240 mg; 14-18 years, 410 mg (boys) and 360 mg (girls); 19-30 years, 400 mg (men) and 310 mg (women); 31 years and older, 420 mg (men) and 320 mg (women). For pregnant women age 14-18 years, the RDA is 400 mg; 19-30 years, 350 mg; 31-50 years, 360 mg. For lactating women age 14-18 years, the RDA is 360 mg; 19-30 years, 310 mg; 31-50 years, 320 mg. For infants less than one year of age, adequate intake (AI) levels are 30 mg from birth to 6 months and 75 mg from 7 to 12 months. The daily upper intake level (UL) for magnesium is 65 mg for children age 1-3 years, 110 mg for 4-8 years, and 350 mg for anyone over 8 years old, including pregnant and breast-feeding women."

Sorry if I find this confusing......the RDA for some is 400mg or over....but the upper limit for anyone is 350mg???

reviewer_info: TracyB, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
comment: Age 52, female menopausal: I take 160 mg (40% daily value) magnesium citrate (1 capsule) every evening with food, 1 - 2 hours before bedtime.  I also take a vitamin energy drink daily that has 200 mg of magnesium glycinate (50% daily value) each morning with food.  FYI: I also take an ace inhibitor in the evenings for blood pressure.  Warnings say that if you take a potassium blocker for blood pressure you may have an interaction, so be very careful!  I have consistently much lower blood pressure now than ever before.  On average: 90's/60s with a pulse rate in the low 70's. I have considerably less fibro pain, my heart palpitations are rare now and very mild (thyroid disease).  I have greatly reduced hot flashes and night sweats, greatly reduced irritability and anxiety, greatly reduced headaches and more energy throughout the day and better focus and concentration.  I am taking the magnesium side by side with 26 billion active bacteria (probiotics) each day.  I take these right before bed when I take my magnesium (because both give me putrid gas for several hours).  This is a side effect not mentioned on the labels of either product.  FYI.  But this it is the only adverse side effect I’ve noticed that I have!  The combination of these two supplements has really improved my mood and overall sense of well being.  Anxiety and negative thinking is now rare and very short lived.  I no longer feel bloated because the digestive tract and bowels are moving, and I have more energy and a positive outlook.  I am amazed that probiotics can actually improve your mental acuity, focus and sense of well being!  Everybody should take these! Read about the immune system and how it effects EVERYTHING in the human body, especially the digestive system, heart and brain!  When I started using magnesium WITH high quality probiotics (I also am very self aware of my stress levels) my old self came back, but a better version.  A healthy diet with exercise make this work even better!

reviewer_info: Taylor, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
Recently, I was diagnosed with what my PCP calls "pharmaceutically-induced mood disorder." 2 years ago, I was on Abilify for a few months for trichotillomania (hair-pulling). I didn't have depression, anxiety, or any mood disorder; apart from the hair-pulling, I was completely healthy. After stopping Abilify cold-turkey (my doctor at the time told me this would be okay; she was WAY wrong), I experienced an intense 5-day-long anxiety attack.  Just constant panic, depression, crying, and depersonalization. On day 5, the "episode" ended just as suddenly as it began.

Ever since then, I'd have weeks of normalcy--even a slight euphoria--and then about 3 days of anxiety and depression that would, again, start without warning, and end just as suddenly.  Sometimes it was 3 days, sometimes more; sometimes it was so bad I couldn't function. Some episodes were more mild, but still very disrupting my life. I also began to pull more hair than ever.

I saw many doctors and was diagnosed with everything from General Anxiety, to Postpartum Depression (I gave birth a year ago), to Bipolar disorder. I knew in my heart the Abilify had caused this, somehow.

I read in a few forums about people having great success with TwinLab Amino Fuel, L-glutamine powder, and magnesium (all three taken together in the mornings on an empty stomach--I take 40 mL, 1 teaspoon, and 250 mg, respectively). I decided to give it a try, since I was desperate, and Abilify had scared me off psychiatric drugs permanently.

Within a week, I felt a LOT better. I started taking another 250 mg magnesium before bed, and now (2 months later) I feel even better, almost 100%. I do get "twinges" of anxiety now and then, but they are so mild and fleeting, I barely notice them; on these days I take an extra magnesium midday. I know the other supplements are helping a lot too, but the magnesium is great just by itself. It feels like I have my life back!! Highly recommend no matter what kind of anxiety you have.

reviewer_info: Joanie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment: I have been taking "Natural Calm" which is a powdered form of Magnesium (ionic magnesium citrate, created from a highly absorbable proprietary blend of citric acid and magnesium carbonate).  It comes in a few different flavors (all natural), and it can be found at Whole Foods stores.  I mix a heaping tablespoon with a glass of water.  It is a relaxing, anti-stress drink, which I take at night (about 30-60 min. before bedtime),and it has helped me greatly in a number of ways:  Helps me to RELAX and SLEEP (I had been plagued with insomnia for years!), AND helps with REGULARITY (bowel movements, as I had also suffered with constipation my whole life).  I was diagnosed w/Fibromyalgia back in the early 1980's, and have tried so many different Rx's over the years, but would end up with unwanted side-effects from each med.  Now, I don't take any Rx meds, just the Natural Calm, plus have changed my diet, which has made a HUGE improvement!  If you're not familiar w/the Paleo diet, you would do yourself an unbelievable favor by checking into it.  It's basically eating REAL food, and eliminating all grains, sugars, and processed "foods".  Not only did it help with weight loss, but I FEEL SO MUCH BETTER in so many ways!  Less fatigue, more mental clarity, less fibro-pain, etc.  God bless each of you, in your quest to feel better and become a healthier individual!  :)

comment: I have fibromyalgia, depression and sleep apena with difficulty falling and staying asleep.  I have found a and was told by a specialitst that you need to start with a small dose of magnesium once a day (ie: 250 mg) for a few days and then increase it to twice a day.  Gradually increase the doses until you reach the peak of diarrhea; then back the dosing down until it subsides. Stay on that does awhile and if needed, try taking the dose up gradually again.  I take a 1,000 mg twice a day and it helps with feeling less stressed as well.  Also, for you chocolate cravers...magnesium is in chocolate and magnesium does help reduce and even eliminate cravings, which is different than having a urge to have some chocolate and being satisified.  My friend teases me and says why takes magnesium when you can eat chocolate????  My blood work has been perfectly fine and, as always, discuss this with your MD first.  Not all MD's will support this idea or even understand it (I am a Registered Nurse).  I don't mess with other products as I am on Paxil, which reduces the amount of Aleve I need for the fibromyalgia and, it helps the depression. reviewer_info: Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Consumer)
comment:
Pros: I think it does help with ED, though probably not enough on its own. It seems to lower blood sugar or strengthen the effectiveness of insulin. 

Cons: Dry mouth and skin on hands feels really leathery when in water for more than a minute. Skin returns to normal and dry mouth is reduced after about a week or not using it. The lower blood sugar can also catch you off guard. Others have reported this supplement will cause an allergic reaction if you're allergic to pine. It's also expensive, particularly if labeled "Pycnogenol". Other cheaper supplements advertise similar benefits and you may want to consider those if you experience issues taking this or want to save money.

25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
I've never posted a review on this web-site, but I feel it's important to post this one for other people who may have pine allergies.
I purchased a skin serum with Pycnogenol as the primary ingredient. The intended use of the serum was to calm and soothe the easily irritated skin on my face. Certain foods & environmental factors make my skin very red and inflamed, and this product claimed to help with my symptoms. Unfortunately (and shame on me) I didn't realize that Pycnogenol is derived from Pine trees. I tested positive for "Pine Mix" during my allergy screening but never "put two and two together" when using this face serum. It took me about a month of being miserable, a trip to my allergy doctor, and tons of blood work to realize that the serum was making my allergies WAY worse. The primary adverse reaction that I had was dry mouth and subtle swelling of my tongue, which was very scary. It also seemed that while using this serum (twice/ day,) I was more sensitive to other foods/ environmental factors that set off my allergies.
In my opinion, if you have any kind of sensitivity to Pine, you should stay away from this ingredient.

comment:
I craved wine. I began drinking as a teenager. I quit while pregnant & raising my little ones. At 35, I used to drink it, or some liquor, almost daily. At 42, I didn't have liver disease (yet), but I would drink to excess often. An employee of GNC told me she took Milk Thistle 3 times a day because it cleans the liver. 
I began taking it 3 X day, religiously. Within a few weeks, all I noticed was that I wasn't drinking as much because I had become more sensitive to alcohols effect. Then I realized I didn't crave it anymore & drank less often. Milk Thistle really helps me to curb my intake. At 48, I've used it for years. If I run out or just get sick of taking pills, it never fails, I start to drink more again. So I buy more Milk Thistle.
Note: watch the label. I don't have it down to a science yet but if you buy a "weak" formula, you won't get the same results. Been there, done that. Look on the Supplement Facts for: "Serving size 2 capsules", "Milk Thistle Extract...Standardized to contain 80% Silymarin, 192 (or near that)mg."

comment: This tree has remarkably changed my life the first thing I would like to mention is there a 58 different varieties of the tree, and it grows in many different places such as India, Africa, the Philippines, Mexico, and Hawaii to name a few. But it grows best in places close to the equator.it's incredibly important to do your due diligence to research what variety you intend to take and its nutritional value.the variety that grows in India is actually the most nutrient dense. And was named plant of the year in 2008 by the National Institute of Health. it has also been quoted by John Hopkins University for saying it will in fact cure, treat, & arrest over 320 different diseases.it's also incredibly important to be seeing if your variety of Moringa is in fact organic, and it has to be fully organic. Which means no pesticides, herbacides or fungicides. it's also extremely important to look at how the tree was grown, and what conditions, and how the tree was harvested, which includes how it was dried. If it was dried in heat, or in the shade. Shade drying is much more expensive and time consuming, however it is critical to keep the bioavailabilityof the plant alive and heat/sun  drying will kill all of the nutrients which will mean you're basically eating grass clippings nutrition wise.my best suggestion to everyone reading this is to do your research, look for Moringa that comes with a guarantee in from a credible organic source.my own personal experience since I started using Moringa has been: I no longer suffer from the back pain the used to experience from being hit by truck 25 years ago, my energy levels are through the roof, my son who suffered from ADD issues have had phenomenal results with his mental clarity and ability to concentrate, my 4 year old daughter won't stop going through growth spurts, and we very rarely have a cold or the flu in our house. reviewer_info: David, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Consumer)
comment:
I was taking Gemfibrozil (1200mg/day) to lower Triglycerides and LDL's, and was advised to take statins for additional reductions in total cholesterol and HDL improvement. I opted for Niaspan.
I was also taking Avapro and Metoprolol for high blood pressure. 
I worked up to 1500 mg/d of Niaspan, but cut back due to increasing flushing incidents and unusual tiredness and weekness in quadriceps. After settling in at 1000 mg/d of Niaspan, blood tests showed no improvement in total cholesterol, no change on HDL's, increased LDL's, and a doubling of triglycerides to about 260; all versus pre-Niaspan measures. 
Decreased Gemfibrozil progressively in 30 day increments(1200-600-0 mg/d) to see if unusual tiredness and muscle weakness would subside. Noticed little improvement in those areas, but Triglycerides went to 560 and LDL's could not be measured due to high
Triglycerides. It appears that for me Niaspan at 1000 mg/d is ineffective, and perhaps counterproductive compared to Gemfibrozil at 1200 mg/d. Given the unusual tiredness and other side effects that I have tolerated in over 25 years of high blood pressure/high cholesterol prescription drug therapy, I am starting to think that it may be time to start exploring natural medicines.

reviewer_info: Slippery, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment:
Many people have experienced the annoying, sometimes downright painful sensation of niacin flush at least once during their life, and probably didn't even know what it was.
Niacin, by nature, is a great way of reducing your cholesterol. Many over-the-counter cholesterol medications include high does of niacin, among other ingredients. However, one of the unfortunate side effects of taking doses of niacin is the effect explained below, called "niacin flush".
Niacin causes the capillaries to get bigger, and the end result is the "flush". The increase in size of your capillaries causes, in some cases, a redness on your skin in the areas that it is occurring. This is the first part of niacin flush. The second reaction of niacin flush is the annoying, and sometimes painful itch that comes along with it. This itch is actually healthy! The reason you are experiencing this itch is because the niacin has allowed more blood to reach your cells to remove toxins from them. As toxins are carried away and your cell becomes healthier, it is finally able to "call" your body for help! Your body responds by sending what is called a histamine to the cell. Histamines cause you to itch, but they also allow your body to send more water, blood, and nutrients to the area that called them.
To sum it all up, the niacin flush is actually a very healthy reaction from your body! You shouldn't be alarmed when you get it; actually the very opposite! It means your body is healing itself. You'll notice that after a certain dosage of niacin that eventually you will not receive the niacin flush any longer. Once you up the dosage, you may experience it again. Your doctor can recommend a good healthy dosage for you.
I hope this helps clear up the common misconception that niacin is actually harming your body. So, when you get it, try to sit back, relax, cope with the short annoyance that it causes, and think about the GOOD that it is doing for your body. Remember, it WILL GO AWAY!

reviewer_info: Oswald1968, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)

The second reaction of niacin flush is the annoying, and sometimes painful itch that comes along with it. This itch is actually healthy! The reason you are experiencing this itch is because the niacin has allowed more blood to reach your cells to remove toxins from them. As toxins are carried away and your cell becomes healthier, it is finally able to "call" your body for help! Your body responds by sending what is called a histamine to the cell. Histamines cause you to itch, but they also allow your body to send more water, blood, and nutrients to the area that called them.
To sum it all up, the niacin flush is actually a very healthy reaction from your body! You shouldn't be alarmed when you get it; actually the very opposite! It means your body is healing itself. You'll notice that after a certain dosage of niacin that eventually you will not receive the niacin flush any longer. Once you up the dosage, you may experience it again. Your doctor can recommend a good healthy dosage for you.
I hope this helps clear up the common misconception that niacin is actually harming your body. So, when you get it, try to sit back, relax, cope with the short annoyance that it causes, and think about the GOOD that it is doing for your body. Remember, it WILL GO AWAY!

comment: I take 500 mg niacin with a separate milk thistle pill (for liver protection) 3 x per day with meals.  For me, the secret to minimizing side effects, or doing away with them altogether, is to take the pill with a BALANCED MEAL.  By that I mean, one with fat, carbohydrate and protein. E,g, a peanut butter sandwich; toast and eggs scrambled in canola oil; chicken, baked potato, salad.  If I take it only with a snack, I experience symptoms, which decreased with increased length of use.  If you can get through the first two weeks, your body does adapt and symptoms lessen. It is worth it to me to not take lifelong medication.  Haven't had my cholesterol rechecked yet, but this treatment regime is recommended by conventional medical practitioners and is not an "alternative" or "holistic" treatment.

reviewer_info: Azaad, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
Over the last seven years, cough had always been the biggest health issue of my life. Sometimes I´d catch cold and have it either during it and sometimes just post-viral cough that would last for months, and sometimes my cough would trigger off during hours of stress or tension. In my case it used to be so relentless that even a cortisone would cause a minor relief, as opposed to going away completely.

Then my elder brother looked up online and found onion as a recommended remedy. To be very honest I was very skeptical of it given how many popular and centuries remedies such as ginger, turmeric or even honey had had zero effect so far.

So my brother asked my mom to dip an onion in half a glass water (it forms a very basic part the Pakistani kitchen) and after a few hours I began taking it spoon by spoon and it worked like magic. Wow, I´ll never forget that day and the immediate relief that it provided! We´d dip it overnight and I´d take it the following day for 10-12 days and the cough cured completely as I´m off it now.

On my way, I discovered how wonderfully it works even on intestinal inflammation, although I´m yet to find it being listed online as one of its benefits. No, I´m not a patient of inflammatory bowel disease, but I do have IBS (irritable bowel syndrome) and some food often cause me intestinal inflammation. So I now occasionally use it to counter that, and it is great for IBS anyway. It just can´t be made a part of the daily routine though due to the bad breath that it gives.

So, whereas it immediately helped me with my cough, through my experience I discovered two more benefits of it and I thought I must state it somewhere online as a reference for others. Turmeric too works great for intestinal inflammatiom but I can´t take that for the mysterious insomnia that it causes me each time I take that. So I´m pleased to have come to discovered about the medical benefits that I can draw from onions.

reviewer_info: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
nikkin, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
Oolong tea is a traditional Chinese ceremonial tea. Its medical value is incidental, I believe, to the joy of drinking it. High quality Oolong tea can be re-steeped numerous times, up to five or six. The caffeine in the tea is extracted through the first steeping so you aren't going to be inundating your body with caffeine if you drink it correctly. I would never go with a tea-bag version. Buy loose leaf with a nice sized tea steeper and steep at around 200 degrees Fahrenheit (not boiling though you can see the little bubbles on the sides of the glass.

Some Oolong varietals that I highly recommend (for their taste, mainly)--Dragon Oolong, Milk Oolong, Iron Goddess Ooling and so many more. 

As a note, I have both anxiety and panic disorders and I don't find the amount of caffeine in the tea to aggravate my symptoms, though it does wake me up and improve cognitive function (at least from a subjective viewpoint). Also, it curbs cravings for me. I don't even think about food. I think this is as much about the satisfying mouthfeel as it is about the caffeine. 

Obviously, if you are intolerant to caffeine, you should not drink the first steeping. While I would still talk to my doctor before doing this, I have had customers with caffeine problems steep out the caffeine, pour out the first glass (or better yet share it) and then drink five more steepings. It really is hearty and fantastic.

reviewer_info: FromChicago, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
Pancreatin works wonders if you do not have intestinal damage (leaky gut syndrome/ intestinal permeability). Even probiotics (ie. L. Acidophilus, rhamnosus, casei, etc) should be avoided (see Mayo Clinic site). When you have intestinal damage ANY thing you take and/or eat including pancreatin and probiotics, can leave the GI tract (through the tiny holes created by these damage), and go straight to your blood, where it does not belong, and can go anywhere in our body, possible causing multiple organ failure, an auto-immune attack, skin sores/itching, and/or asthma, imflamation etc. In the case of the previous reviewer’s dog, the dog’s body (actually his liver) is trying to get ride of the pancreatin in his blood though his/her skin. 

What to do? Whether is for you or your dog, you can still take very low dosages but you have to fix the intestinal damage also! L-Glutamine is great for that, specially when combine with N-Acetyl Cysteine, and Zinc. There are others that also help: slippery elm, marshmallow root, aloe vera. No probiotics for at least 3 momnths!, no sugar, no carbohydrates, specially grains! For HUMANS buy the smallest capsule size available (I re-encapsulate it myself and I buy un-diluted pancreatin) and take the mini-caps while eating so it mixes with my food in my stomach. For DOGS: buy your dog grain-free/no-carbs/low-carbs/low-sugar/no-sugar food (or cook for him, I cook for mine ?), put food in a mini-grinder, add some water (specially if dry food) and a very small amount of pancreatin and mix it well. Of course take care of any Candida overgrowth and parasites also. I do this for me and my dogs.

Best wishes!

reviewer_info: 65-74 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment: 11 year prostate cancer survivor had surgery then 5 years later salvage radiation then two years later hormone therapy.  I have Bio Chemical Recurrence with no metastasis. Doubling time ( the length of time the PSA doubles) determines the aggressiveness of the cancer.  After each treatment my PSA would go up with doubling time of 4 months.  It was always 0, .3, .6, 1.2 then a treatment. My blood tests are at 4 month intervals. After hormone therapy it was less than .1 for two years then started going up again. It went less than .1 to .3 in 4 months, then .6 4 months later (doubled).  I had heard about a report saying that pomegranate juice could possibly slow down the doubling time (aggressiveness) so when my PSA hit .6 I started drinking about 12 oz. of a pomegranate juice cocktail made by Langers. It is 20% pomegranate juice per 8 oz. (has some sugar) every night.  My next blood est PSA was 1.0 (didn't double in 4 months) next blood test 4 months later 1.4, next 4 month test 1.9 that is where I am as of today 12/23/2016.  Although not proven it has slowed my doubling time from 4 months to about 10 months.  I believe in it.  It may not work for every one but so far it has helped me.  I firmly believe more research needs to be done on his subject.

The last time I had my blood flow checked after using the pomegranate juice for a cpl years the artery they stented had less blood flow than the one they did nothing to...lol  I whole heartedly recommend pomegranate juice for clogged arteries.  I also take magnesium, folic acid, B3, D3 and cayenne pills.  I quit using all the blood thinners, statins, blood pressure meds 9 months after my heart attack and have treated myself with the above items and have been problem free for over 8 years.  Anyone taking those drugs should read the side effects.  I was weak and fatigued all the time on them.  Since I read up and began self medicating I feel I have been rejuvenated.  I would recommend pomegranate and cayenne pills to anyone experiencing clogged artery's.  The other things are for heart health. Recently I have also began using tart cherry juice as it also is an excellent inflammation fighter.  Inflammation is the root cause of 90% of the ailments we as humans experience and pomegranate juice and tart cherry are two of the best inflammation fighters out there.  Both are excellent anti-oxidants!  Cayenne is an excellent plaque remover.  The first three years after my heart attack I took it daily (3 times) and then moved to once a week.  Back then when I experienced chest pain I would again take it daily and within a week I was fine.  I seldom have any chest pain due to my heart anymore and believe when I do it is something else entirely as heartburn.  Oh yeah, eating celery daily works great to lower blood pressure also!  Its great with peanut butter which is heart friendly fats also...grin!

reviewer_info: kemorgan65, 45-54 Female  (Consumer)
comment:
In my lifetime I always catch every flu or cold that I'm exposed to. Since drinking tuna cactus leaf 'brew', none of these can get a hold on me. If I start symptoms of the sniffles, by the next day it's forgotten. Nowadays I'll set a bottle of tuna once a month and drink for about a week and that seems to keep my immune system strong for at least 2 months. Once when I had not drunk it for several months and started coming down with the flu, I set a bottle and started drinking several glasses the following day : it was like taking a multisymptom tablet... I could feel I still was sick but the symptoms had practically disappeared. 
I've also shared a bottle with a young man suffering with  severe stomach ulcers. His doctor's orders were to stop each food cooked with oil, I don't remember what medication he was on or if he could afford it. A week later he called me saying that he felt so much better and was actually able to enjoy a meal again.

I make tuna water drink (I don't know if it's correct to call it 'juice') by cleaning 1 or 2 leaf paddles, cutting each into strips that can fit into a wide-mouthed bottle (or jar), then slicing each strip to expose the interior flesh. I usually put the pieces in a clean plastic 2 litre bottle, fill with filtered water almost to the top, squeeze the bottle so the water level reaches the rim and screw on the cap. Turn bottle a few times to shake water, put in refrigerator for at least about 8 hours to 'set' (shake bottle a few times during the course of the day) then it's ready to drink. A glass a day is fine, even half glass once or twice a day for as long as it tastes fresh. Always top up with fresh water to minimise exposure to air, shake, and the bottle can last for up to 2 weeks. Stop using as soon as taste/smell/look changes. Tastes almost like water. Sometimes it will gel the water which can be difficult to swallow (I think it depends on age of leaf) so drinking daily and topping up will keep it from getting too thick.

reviewer_info: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment: It's rare that i go online to post reviews and things like this but i felt the need to share my story because i feel this fruit is definitely something that can help people. I have been suffering from an inflammatory eye condition called episcleritis--a condition with normally  unknown causes which makes your eye all red and sore. It's not the most serious condition but it is recurring and very annoying/uncomfortable--and people always think you have pink eye (or worse). The only available treatments are NSAIDS like ibuprofen or steroid eye drops, neither of which are good for you in the long run, not to mention they don't always work well. Being Mexican I'm familiar with prickly pears (we call them tunas) but only ate them once in a long while. Recently I was looking up anti-inflammatory foods online, trying to find some kind of food or supplement to take besides ibuprofen.I came across some websites that mentioned prickly pears' anti-inflammatory properties and since I'm familiar with the fruit I decided to eat some when my eye started flaring up. Lo and behold the inflammation subsided and I was back to normal within a day or two. I thought maybe it was a coincidence  but the next two times my eye started flaring up I ate three or four of the fruits per day and again, the same positive result. It doesn't completely stop me from getting it but it has turned something that would irritate me and make me look like Darth Maul for a week or more to something that is manageable and I can nip it in the bud within a couple of days. So if any other people out there have this condition I suggest you give prickly pears a try. Best to buy them at Mexican markets because I hear some health food stores charge outrageous prices for them. I get them for 99 cents for 2 lbs.

comment:

Over time I have learned that all natural and non-timed release work best. I have taken the Stress B+ from Douglas Labs for over 20 years. During good times I take 1 and when the weather gets screwy, I take 2. My doctors are amazed at how well I am doing and that I rarely take pain medications. Since starting to take B6, I have gone from unable to walk more than a few steps to hiking all day in the mountains. 
As a side note, when I was discovering B6, my cousin started giving B6 to my uncle for Diabetes Neuralgia. His tolerance for blood sugar changes was very small. He would quickly go into low or high blood sugar states while still having blood sugar in the "normal" range. After starting to take the B6, he started having more "normal" tolerance for blood sugar changes. He was still diabetic but it didn't affect his life as much. He was elderly and passed but his life was much improved.

reviewer_info: OrangesNBanaynays, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment:
I am a trampoline when it comes to weight. I lost a bunch of weight 5 years ago eating brown rice prepared by my dad during high school. When I went off to college, I couldn't keep up the same diet and so gained back a lot of weight. Now that I graduated and living at home, I wanted to eat brown rice again but my dad decided that red rice was better for me because he knew people back in China that ate red rice to lower cholesterol. So, every morning, I grab my lunch box of red rice and cooked veggies and lean meat to work. The first day, I ate the whole box. It would've been tasteless if my dad didn't add a little chicken stock and veggie/meat sauce to the rice. The 3rd day up to the 10th (last day, today) was where I ran into problems. It wasn't that I'm unable to stick to the diet or that I lacked the will power but half-way into the meal, I had the sudden urge to run to the bathroom. For the rest of the work day, I experienced a very bad bloating in the abdominal region and became dizzy and hot for the next 5 working hours. Today, I ate a small sandwich for lunch instead and ate my red rice meal at 5 PM. I felt great and energetic up until 5. So, I thought I'm at such an unhealthy state of being that I would feel like crap around 12 PM everyday that I never suspected the red rice. At 5 PM, approximately 5 bites in, I had to run to the bathroom with-quite frankly- a bad case of the poops. During the entire drive with my brother, I was so dizzy that I threw up a little. Fed up, I google searched about any side effects to this new lifestyle that I'm engaging myself in and came across WebMD which did explain the same side effects that I was having. Whew!

So just a warning: don't eat red rice religiously because there are side effects of dizziness (sometimes severe), immediate diarrhea, and raised body temperature. These effects can last for several hours.

reviewer_info: doronrapp, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment:
Resveratrol is a product that is available in different purities, 5% to almost 100% pure. That’s the reason for the difference in prices, from $10.00 to $100.00 or more per bottle. Pure resveratrol means a product that contains only pure TRANS-resveratrol- the beneficial substance in resveratrol. One should always read the label carefully. Pure resveratrol should be indicated on the label as “Standardized to 99%” or “99% pure Tarns resveratrol”. If the label does not indicate purity information then the product may be worthless.

Most resveratrol in the market is obtained from Japanese knotweed which is high in concentration of resveratrol and cost less to produce than from grapes.  The notion that grape resveratrol is superior to Japanese knotweed is a total myth.

Allergic reaction to resveratrol is very rare but it happens just as it can happen with any other foods.  Less than one percent of users are allergic to resveratrol.  Pure trans-resveratrol is not known to cause any side effects; however that is not true with low purity resveratrol. Low purity contains emodin (natural pert of the plant) which may cause gastrointestinal problems and act as a laxative in sensitive individuals.  

Resveratrol benefits:  Resveratrol has a long list of benefits. The top benefit is its ability to prevent heart attacks and strokes.  Resveratrol is a better alternative to Aspirin. As a user myself I truly believe resveratrol saved my life.  11 years ago I survived a heart attack, and since I started taking resveratrol 10 years ago I have had not one incident related to my heart.  For me, consuming resveratrol is like a life-insurance, not consuming resveratrol is like playing roulette with your own life.  Resveratrol is beneficial to many other conditions such as: Cancer, joint disease, Alzheimer’s, liver, aging, cataract, macular- degeneration, Lyme, ant-inflammatory, neurodegenerative disease, MS, cell damage, and athletic endurance.
Doron Efrat- Resveratrol Expert/User

reviewer_info: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment: I am 57 and started using Country Life Resveratrol about 5 monts ago. I take (4)200 mg (each containing 100 mg of Trans-Resveratrol for a total of 400 mg/daily). I started taking it for general health benefits. I have had no side-affects other than weight loss, increased energy levels. and less miagraines! Without dieting or exercise I have lost 25 lbs and have now stabalized at my optimum weight not seen in years. I have even tried to gain weight (as a test) by eating high fat, carbs, sugar etc at a local casino's buffet 2-3x week and my weight did not fluctuate at all! I don't advocate an unhealthy diet but it was a fun month long experiment. In addition I have had chronic, severe migraine headaches for over 15 years having at least 1-2 week requiring perscription meds. I now have only about 1 per month! From what I have read you need at least 350 mg/daily for the benefits to kick in. Make certain that you take that as Trans-Resveratrol. Since a typical 200 mg cap may ony contain 100 mg of Trans-Resveratrol 4-5 are needed daily. I take 200/mg in the morning and 200/mg before bed since the half-life in the body is said to be 8-12 hrs. This will maintain Resveratrol levels through out the day. Next week I will have my 1st blood tests for sugars, cholesterol etc since beginning the regiment and am anxious to see if there has been a change. I was borderline on both before beginning Resveratrol. I hope the long-term benefits are as outstanding. I realize that everyones matabolism is different so doseage, benefits and side-affects may vary as well. All I can say is that it works for me. I buy Country Life Plus 120 Vcaps online through IHERB as they have the best price @ only $17.50 per 120 cap bottle. Plus orders over $40 ship free but under $40 is only $3.40 for thr entire order! One bottle @ 4 per day will last a month. That is only $0.48/daily! All I can say is this workd for me and I am now an advocate. I hope this info has been helpful! Cheers & Good Health! Jerry

reviewer_info: aldag, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)
comment: For years I suffered from a small irritated skin lesion at the base of my nose only on the right hand side. It was intensely itchy for such a small area of skin irritation. The dermatologist prescribed a cortisone cream which worked, but when the cream was discontinued, the lesion and itching came right back. Then I read an article about skin rashes that were the result of low selenium. A doctor recommended eating two Brazil nuts per day to obtain selenium for this type of rash. So I tried this solution and much to my amazement within three days the itching stopped and by the end of a week the lesion had cleared. Then I substituted a yeast based supplement containing selenium for the Brazil nuts and the rash came right back within days. This result was perplexing. Then I tried a better grade supplement, Swanson Albion Complex Selenium and the rash cleared as it had with the Brazil nuts. So the type of selenium supplement makes a huge difference. I would suggest for an atopic dermatitis type rash that the selenium could be tried for possible improvement. Results would be known within the first week.

reviewer_info: WebMD, 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment: I started taking soy isoflavones, 40 mg for hot flashes and insomnia due to menopause.  I have always been a good sleeper and need my sleep to feel well. Going into menopause I became very distressed by insomnia coupled with hot flashes. It got to the point it was making me feel physically ill, and was zapping me of all my energy. After about 1 week taking soy I noticed a big decline in the troubling symptoms I was having. After 1 month on soy I am happy to report I sleep well again and am no longer having hot flashes; I feel great again! I would highly recommend soy isoflavones for other women who are having bothersome menopause symptoms. The brand I use is SpringValley 40 mg Soy Isoflavones, Walmart carries them I believe the usual dose is 80 mg, but I get great relief with just 1 40 mg tablet..

I stopped taking the soy I reported on a while back for no particular reason, but am glad I recently started taking it again.  I feel different, all symptoms I have are lessened on 40 milligrams(one capsule) daily in morning with coffee, sometimes food sometimes not.  I have less itching skin, less flaking of skin, faster healing, no pain in the sore knee at all, overall more agile and flexible, still get some hot flashes in the evening, probably after the soy has been reduced.  I don't take more however because doing this in the past caused me side effects like mild allergies.  I also only like taking this brand.  I have tried a soy with saponins for example and got rashes.  I also love what this does for my digestion.  Going to the bathroom is NORMAL and not painful.  This has helped me not have diverticulitis which I have had for a long time.  No symptoms now whatsoever.  I will continue to report whatever is going on as I continue to take these so as to help others with their decision.  Ive tried other things but nothing worked or they were awful.  I hope they never stop making this particular soy brand.

reviewer_info: Anna88, 25-34 Female  (Consumer)
comment: Be VERY careful about what brand you use. I use the brand 'Sweet Leaf' every time I'm at my parents' home (it's what my mom uses) with no problems and just great, natural no calorie sweetness. I assumed every brand of 'Stevia' was the same and bought a box of PurVia packets and have been using them for about a week (about 3 packets a day in a big jug of homemade iced green tea that I normally just use honey in) -and have been experiencing headaches like crazy and (sounds gross I know, but I have to put this) slimy stool and diarrhea. At the beginning of the week the symptoms weren't so bad, but now they are terrible and I absolutely have to stop the PureVia. I can't believe this is happening, but this is literally the ONLY thing that I have changed in my diet and I am 100% sure it has to be the PureVia causing it. I talked to my mom (at least about the headaches!) and she told me that some of the Stevia 'brands' use a processed extract called Rebiana (or RebA) and add dextrose (like PureVia does!) instead of just using the natural plant. I did some more research and it turns out that the actual plant has been used with great results for thousands of years but the RebA extract has NOT been properly studied before being released (WHY they use it instead of just what is naturally occurring is beyond me). Anyway, the rest of these packets are going in the TRASH and I'm going to hunt out some Sweet Leaf brand Stevia tomorrow. I use it every time I'm at my mom's and though of course it does not taste just like sugar (and is way stronger, only use a little at first) I have had no problems with it and it feels good to be using something NATURAL and not chemical while trying to still keep both my hot and iced tea 'sweet' while keeping calories down... READ THE LABELS. Don't get anything that has stuff in it you can't pronounce and look for the Sweet Leaf brand if you can find it -my mom swears it's the best one and it's definitely the only one I'll be buying from now on. :)

comment: I am allergic to stevia.  It is in the ragweed family, so many might be allergic as well.  I was ingesting stevia every day for 4-5 years, with much digestive distress, although since I had IBS I figured it was something else.  Under guidance of my chiropractor I did an elimination diet and stevia was the culprit.  After I stopped using it my digestive woes were over, I started menstruating again (after 2 years of no menses- food allergies can cause this), and all is well.  I was using the pure version, even grew the plant in my backyard.  Shame, because I really liked the taste and convenience of stevia.  I do not generally have a ragweed allergy, but just particular to stevia.  Have done tests since to reintroduce to my diet, but it creates what I call the "instant washing machine on high agitation" effect in my stomach, and then I get horrible gas and bloating.

comment: I have been using stevia  for over 8 years to sweeten beverages. I started using it originally for weight loss. reviewer_info: Caroline S, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment:
Well, I found Stevia extract too bitter. I found Truvia et al WAY too expensive so decided to take matters into my own hands. Armed with a calculator, I first of all purchased 16 oz Stevia extract with 90% Steviasoides from Mood and Mind. My aim was to produce a calibrated liquid extract that I could add to food and drink. I figured that my 1lb pack gave me the equivalent sweetening power of 350 lbs of sugar (about a 15 years supply!) and worked from there.

This is what I calculated.. add 10 grams of the above product (I have an inexpensive cooking scale that measures to 1 gram) to 700 ml water in a bottle or jar and shake well. Refrigerate. I obtained a kid's 5ml medicine dropper calibrated into 1ml divisions for $1.00 and my calculations mean that 1ml of this liquid is equal to 1 teaspoon of sugar .. and yes it works!  I have used it to make a spectacular organic walnut cheesecake, to sweeten iced tea, iced coffee, salad dressing.. I will keep a dropper bottleful in my purse for use when I'm away from home. I have also checked out research into health benefits and found that Stevia is used for treating diabetes, high blood pressure and heartburn; for lowering uric acid levels; and for increasing the strength of the muscle contractions that pump blood from the heart. As I have an inherited genetic condition called Hypertrophic Obstructive Cardiomyopathy and have to take a Uric Acid-elevating diuretic for the consequential heart failure, this could be a great "treatment" for me.. Highly recommended!

reviewer_info: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment: I was consuming about 4,000 mg of Stevia per day, (in green tea), and started having 100 - 150 incidents of heart palpitations per day. I visited a doctor, who captured the irregular heart beats on an EKG, and order me to wear a holter monitor for 2 days. This captured the irregular heart beats and even short events of Ventricular Tachychardia. I was sent to a heart specialist, under who's care I am currently in, and I have since ceased all Stevia intake. My heart has returned to normal, with only very rare occurrences of any irregular heart rhythms, (as was the case prior to me using Stevia). I loved using Stevia, as it tasted great and was, I believed at the time, the healthiest sweetener alternative available to me. I am just disappointed I can never use it again.

reviewer_info: AllergyAnna, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: 8 year stroke survivor, migraines and lupus. I take 14 medications daily so I'm pretty diligent about researching side effects and interactions. Have gained weight over the years due to perm damage of strokes and the different facets of lupus - am unable to get much exercise.  I eat very healthy but need my morning coffee sweetened.  Had been using spenda in each of my 3 cups each morning. About two weeks ago I decided to try stevia to help with my attempts at weight loss. Tasted quite good.  Have been in a lupus flare for about a month, and just finished a dose pak of prednisone.  Due to the aroused lupus symptoms I didn't even realize that I'd been building up to a allergic reaction to the stevia. Hands and feet swelling (pins n needles), eyes puffy and irritated and face getting a little redder each day. Inside lips felt swelled and throat was even a sore, a little dificulty swallowing - felt somewhat better as each day went on. BUT last night I had a cup of coffee with stevia (very rarely drink coffee in evening). Awoke 4am with burning red face. Arose for the day at 9:30.  I could feel all the symptoms getting stronger as I was drinking coffee. Finally realized/recognized that it must be an allergic reaction to the stevia! Made worse by the late evening coffee! Poured out my third cup and headed to the ER for treatment.  Sometimes we get so used to how our bodies feel that we don't immediately recognize new effects/symptoms.

reviewer_info: Alan,  Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment: There are probably dozens of herbs, vitamins, and supplements that purportedly help to relieve the symptoms of BPH.  I've tried ALL of them, and I've tried them for long, long periods of time.  Most of them are, for all intents and purposes, snake oil.  That said, a few of them do offer some relief.  Stinging Nettle (a.k.a. Urtica Dioica) is one of them.  How many times have we seen the following: "Results are inconclusive." In my humble opinion,take it for what it's worth, that means that whatever the supplement in question may be, it's definitely working for some.  I lucked out. Yes. The results are anecdotal, but it's definitely doing something positive for me.  Full disclosure; I also take dutasteride (Brand: Avodart), and Cialis (Generic - not available - 5mg). I take both maintenance drugs on a routine, daily basis.  I'd be lost without these two drugs.  However, while I've been taking these prescription meds for nine years, and they HAVE given me relief, I've upped that relief by adding Stinging Nettle, and the difference is noticeable. Hope this helps.

reviewer_info: HEARTY GUY, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Consumer)
comment:
NETTLE ALMIGHTY
I drink 1 nettle leaf tea every evening before bed. No sugar (my taste bud are small and unimportant and they follow what the brain tells them). My tea is strong as it steeps for hours prior to drinking. This one nightly drink has transformed my lower limbs. I had dependent edema swelling up my feet, ankles and legs for more than 10 years. The fluid retention was caused by sitting in a wheelchair 14 hours/day. 

Just as the German health care system and MDs there believe, nettle leaf does indeed have a diuretic effect. In my case, a very BIG one BUT not something that overpowers my bladder-- the effect is slow and steady. Slow and steady has won the race for me. I no longer need to lie down 1x-2x times a day and have my health aid put thigh-high alternating air pump compression cuffs on to reduce my pitting edema! Freedom! One single nettle leaf tea (well steeped) every night does the trick. Take it from a true sufferer of dependent edema, nettle leaf really works well. I do NOT agree that there is "insufficient evidence that nettle leaf [is effective] against "water retention." 

I'm guessing from my personal experience that SERIOUS studies would show that nettle leaf is effective for water retention!

reviewer_info: Gigan988, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment: I used to take Nasonex, a steroid based nasal spray, every day for my year around sinus allergies. I then switched to a daily routine of Allegra, after years of taking Nasonex, to get away from the steroid addiction. A combination of cost, and not wanting to be dependent on allopathic medication, led me to investigate alternative medicine treatments for treating allergic rhinitis. I tried bromelain (an extract from pineapple stem), and it didn't help. Also gave me an irritated stomach. I was lucky that the second supplement I tried, Stinging Nettle leaf, was exactly what I needed. To fast forward, I now take Stinging Nettle leaf daily, and only need an Allegra on rare occasion for very bad hayfever days. I take an Allegra about once a month now, while previously needed it every day. As for the stinging nettle, as an herb, it took a bit of time to take effect, but now I breathe easy most of the time. I experimented with dosage; I started with 300mg a day, then tried 500mg, then a whole gram, then 600mg, then 900mg. I find that 600mg a day works for me, although I sometimes take 900mg for the heck of it. I would advise anyone with sinus allergies to give it a try.

I plan to continue testing with a product from a health food store until I decide what is best for me. I put a little extra pepper on my food to help the turmeric enter my body. I have noticed other areas of physical improvement that I might attribute to the turmeric but can't be sure.  Plus, I am a born skeptic so this product has truly surprised me.

reviewer_info: mts622, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)
comment: Two and a half years ago I began suffering from osteoarthritis of my hip.  I could barely walk or sleep because of the extreme pain.  A friend reminded me that turmeric was an anti-inflammatory, and I remembered that I had half a bottle of Organic India Turmeric Formula in my drawer.  Although the bottle of Organic India Turmeric Formula said to take 1 to 2 capsules twice a day, I muscle tested myself and my testing showed that I needed to take 3 capsules 3 times a day for a total of 9 capsules a day.  It took four days to it to build up in my body, but by the fourth day I was free of pain.  Note: You MUST take turmeric after eating or with food; otherwise, it does upset your stomach much like taking ibuprofen on an empty stomach.  I also find that it is best to space out the time pretty evenly between breakfast and lunch and between lunch and dinner, because if I let too much time elapse, my hip starts letting me know it is there.
